campaign.story:
We're Peak Design. We design and make products. To preorder this Travel Tripod and bring it to life, click Back This Project. Or scroll on, scroller. 
Take a closer look at the Travel Tripod with Lawrence, Peak Design's boy genius:
And, check out the host of optional accessories that you can add onto your pledge (instructions at end of video):
So why redesign the tripod? Because traditional travel tripods have a critical flaw: tons of wasted space. The result is a tool that is inherently difficult to carry with you into the field. We fixed that, and more. 
We spent 4 years redesigning the tripod from the ground up to eliminate dead space and minimize packed-down size. 
But we didn't stop at space savings. 
We made a tool that deploys and packs down rapidly—nearly twice as fast as a traditional tripod. We made it intuitive and delightful to use. We engineered professional-quality stability and performance. And we added thoughtful features to help you get the shot— with any gear, in any environment, from any point of view.  
We built the Travel Tripod around the photographer's workflow. How? We are photographers.

We loaned pre-production samples of the Travel Tripod to some of our favorite creatives on Youtube. Here's what they had to say:
Peter McKinnon compares the PD Travel Tripod to the Gitzo Traveler:
Manny Ortiz goes ham on the Carbon Fiber Travel Tripod in downtown Chi-town:
Kitty Peters of Atola Visuals goes deep on the Travel Tripod and shares footage from our media unveiling event we hosted in San Francisco:
TechCrunch interviews Peter Dering and Art Viger on the design considerations behind the Travel Tripod:
Alright, let's dive deeper into every crevice of the Travel Tripod's functionality:
Pro performance. Half the size.
The Travel Tripod takes up half the volume of a traditional travel tripod. We also eliminated bulky, protruding knobs. The result? Every water bottle pocket on your bag is now also a tripod pocket, and you're carrying a full sized tripod with professional capabilities.

Set it up (and pack it down) faster.
With traditional travel tripods, slow setup may mean a missed shot. Not with the Peak Design Travel Tripod. We designed strong, easy-to-use leg cam levers that can be operated together (no tedious twist locks!). With our architecture there's no need for the legs to flip up/down when packing and unpacking.  And, we topped it off with lightning-fast camera quick-attachment/release.
Current office record: 9.4 seconds from packed to legs deployed.

Love thy ball head.
No more guessing which knob to turn or how far to turn it: a single and precision-engineered adjustment ring gives total articulation. Our locking ring gives you further stability and vibration reduction. But even without it, your camera is locked securely in place. The unique head design gives you greater range of articulation, and incorporates 3 portrait mode cutouts instead of 1.
Made for the camera in your bag.
Make no mistake: the Travel Tripod is small, but it's ready for big jobs. High-performance materials and precision machined parts yield weight capacity, stability, and vibration dampening comparable to much larger, more expensive tripods. The Travel Tripod is designed to handle pro photography gear, easily handling a full-frame DSLR with a 70-200 lens. Combining a 20lb weight capacity with a 60" max height, the Travel Tripod performs as well as any other in its class. 
Also made for the camera in your pocket.
There's a reason that phones are already the most used cameras in the history of cameras: mobile devices take incredible pictures,  they're only getting better, and you always have it with you. That's why we gave the Travel Tripod a brilliant, stowable, universal mobile mount hidden in the center column.
More points of view. More environments. 
It takes just seconds to switch to Inverted Mode, perfect for macro or product photography. Or, with a few turns of the included hex wrench, you can reconfigure into Low Mode. The Travel Tripod goes lower than any other tripod in its class, enabling unmatched ground perspective shots. Plus our separately available add-ons give even more versatility: the Universal Head Adaptor lets our tripod with any tripod head, our Spike Feet add grip in ice and looser terrain, and the Ultralight Conversion Kit removes the bottom 4 sections of each leg and takes almost half the weight off your tripod making it an incredible tabletop-sized backpacking tripod. Check out our addendum video for more info on the accessories. 
A zippered soft case from the legendary Peak Design soft goods department, plus all the tools to use and maintain your new tripod: our precision machined aluminum Standard Plate, a hex wrench for plate tightening and tripod maintenance, and the phone mount mentioned above.
L-brackets and 3rd party tripod plates. Remove the pins on the ball head for longer plates. Compatible with most Arca Swiss plates. 
How about the entire Peak Design Ecosystem. Secure Anchor connection points let you carry the Travel Tripod with any Peak Design strap. The Travel Tripod uses the same plate that comes with our Capture Camera Clip. Carry the Travel Tripod in (or on) any Peak Design bag. It's the size and shape of a water bottle, making it easy to carry in any bag you want.


Durable, serviceable, and guaranteed for life.
Weatherproof and impact-resistant, we built the Travel Tripod to give you years of joy. How many years? A lifetime. Like all Peak Design products, we guarantee the Travel Tripod for life (see warranty details in the FAQ). We made every part of the Travel Tripod serviceable, cleanable, and replaceable, to give it a longer lifespan and generate less waste.
Ready to take the plunge? Click Back This Project, and pick a reward.
Then let's add on some accessories:

Peep this sick vid for details on the above add-ons, and instructions on how to add them:

And what if you're detail-oriented?
Tripod Specs, Materials & Performance Testing
We've been working with a Stanford physicist during pre-production to ensure the Peak Design Travel Tripod has pro-level stability. Well, he's not just any Stanford physicist. David Berryrieser is the founder of The Center Column, a site dedicated to scientifically testing tripods. David may be the world's foremost expert on tripod performance.
In short, the Peak Design Travel Tripod is as stable, if not more stable, than most other travel tripods in its class. That means you get extreme compactness without sacrificing performance.
David tests tripods using harmonic oscillation. For more info on what that means and how the Peak Design Travel Tripod compares to others, read Update #8. Here's what the testing looks like:
Testing of the PD Carbon Fiber Travel Tripod. Note how much less movement there is versus the otherwise comparable 3rd party travel tripod below.
Testing of the MeFOTO Road Trip Carbon Fiber Travel Tripod.
Again, read Update #8 for the full story behind our performance testing.

Environmental & Social Impact
Making and selling stuff creates pollution. It is Peak Design's responsibility to clean up that mess, and find ways to make less mess in the first place. It is also our responsibility to look out for the well-being of the many people who contribute to Peak Design, ensuring that we succeed at the expense of nobody.
Below are the key sustainability and responsibility considerations in making the Travel Tripod. You can learn about Peak Design's company-wide sustainability plan here.
Travel Tripod is carbon neutral. That means that zero net greenhouse gases are emitted when making/delivering the Travel Tripod. We achieve this by measuring the Scope 1-3 carbon footprint of the Travel Tripod, from raw material mining to manufacturing to shipping to the end customer. We then reduce or offset that carbon footprint in its entirety. Peak Design is fully carbon neutral, all the way back to the beginning of our company.
Travel Tripod is fully serviceable, and nearly every single part is individually replaceable. It also comes with a lifetime guarantee. This means less material has the chance to end up in a landfill.
Travel Tripod is built in factories that pay workers fairly and provide for their safety. Peak Design works with our partner factories to maintain a code of conduct for worker pay, safety, and conditions. We invest in 3rd party audits to ensure these standards are always met. 
1% of Travel Tripod sales go to grassroots environmental nonprofits. Peak Design is a 1% for the Planet member, meaning that 1% of all our revenue goes to protecting wild places. As of April 2019, we've donated over $1 million to environmental nonprofits.

Why Kickstarter?
We launch our products on Kickstarter because it gives us the freedom to run our business exactly how we want. The funds we generate on Kickstarter make it possible for us to continue developing products without seeking venture capital. That means we're not beholden to growth goals, revenue targets, or product timelines imposed by other people. Instead, we focus on doing what we love: building the best things we can possibly make, fueled by support from the best customers we could possibly ask for.
This is our 9th Kickstarter project since 2011. From the beginning, our backers have steered the direction of our product roadmap, both with their feedback, and with direct participation in our design process via surveys and focus groups. This close collaboration is made possible by communication and community-building tools of the Kickstarter platform.
Thank you for letting us continue on this incredible journey.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 9th Kickstarter project since 2011. Through the years we've gotten pretty darn good at setting accurate expectations and delivering on our promises. But no matter how much we've got our poop in a group (official midwestern terminology) things can still go awry. If they do, we solemnly promise to give you full transparency into the issues and solve them in a way that leaves our backers happy and proud to support our company.

Supply Chain Risk: Sometimes a machine or tool breaks. Sometimes a factory loses power for a day. Sometimes we get the wrong parts or materials in. These things happen from time to time and can affect how long it takes to build our products.

Shipping Risk: Global shipping and warehousing logistics is mind-boggling. Hence we outsource that stuff to experts. But even the experts aren't immune to weather, port congestion, and other uncontrollable factors.

Acts of God: We're based in San Francisco. That means we could have an earthquake. Or a horrific avocado toast shortage. Whatever happens, we'll get through it together.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Tripod Backers,
Joe here, from the PD Marketing squad. The sun's about to drop below the horizon here in California, and the close of our 10th Kickstarter won't be too far behind it. You've got just a few hours left to get in there and back Kickstarter #10 to lock in a pretty burly discount on our ecosystem of Mobile cases, mounts and accessories.

updates.update_userinfo: A whole new tripod. And so much more.
updates.update_content:
Howdy Travel Tripod backers,
You backed the Travel Tripod because we told you it was the most compact professional tripod we made. Well, that's *not quite true* anymore.

updates.update_userinfo: One very important conversation, a few new awards, five funny stories, and KICKSTARTER NUMBER 10.
updates.update_content:
Hey Everybody. Happy Juneteenth. 
Joe here, the new guy at Peak Design. Adam S. took the afternoon off with an achy sort of fever, so light a candle and some sage for the guy. And me being the new guy on the words-and-videos team, he asked if I could pinch hit an update out to the Kickstarter tribe. So here we are and here we go.
The last KS update went out back in the early days of the quarantine, which seems like lifetimes ago now. Since then, we've all collectively started our other full-time job of attempting to cope with and navigate a pandemic, a recession, and a long-overdue raging howl against systemic racism and injustice that has plagued America since before America was America. Hope you're hanging in there, all things considered. Internally here at Peak, we've been consumed with an ongoing and fairly intense, emotional conversation about what's happening in our country right now, and Peak's place in it. You can follow along with our discussion in the most recent posts. If you'd like to be heard, post a Field Note comment or contact us directly at info@peakdesign.com. Adam spent about 20 hours last week replying to 180+ customer emails about the state of racial inequity in the US, which, in retrospect, may be a contributing factor to why he's feeling feverish and achey today.

updates.update_userinfo: Stay-At-Home Photo+Film Fest, a big launch, and diversions.
updates.update_content:
Ahoy, backers. We hope you're well. Times are strange.
Let's start with the positive: as of a month ago, all tripods have been shipped! If you filled out your survey, you should have a tripod in hand. If you don't have your tripod, scroll down for instructions on how to get it.
For most folks, Kickstarter rewards are the last thing on your mind right now. We're in the midst of a global pandemic and an economic recession. Times are scary and uncertain.

HOWDY FOLKS!
Per our previous update, a large majority of our backers now have Travel Tripods in hand. The response has been absolutely incredible. We love seeing you putting your gear to the test. Be sure to tag your photos/videos with #shotonpdtripod so we can see what you've been up to. Some of our favorites are down at the bottom of this update.
GIVERWAY WINTER 2020

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping continues, a new certification, a new video, and other fun things.
updates.update_content:
Hello friends! Lawrence here reporting from PD HQ in the Dogpatch. Director of Marketing Adam S. is out on paternity leave which is amazing both because he has a child and because we somehow keep the company running without him around. That being said, Adam if you are reading please come back at some point. Backers please note this is Adam S. and not Adam H. It's not clear if Hicksy sleeps, let alone takes time off.
Let's jump right in to it:
SHIPPING

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping! New video! Registration! And one helluva decade.
updates.update_content:
Howdy folks!
It's the last day of the year. The last day of the whole decade. You don't get to say that very often.
This decade has meant a lot to Peak Design. In fact, it's meant everything to us. Peak Design didn't exist last decade. Last decade, the 40 of us who work full-time at Peak Design had different jobs. Some of us were still in high school. Heck, some of us were still in . Not really.
Tripods continue to ship. You continue to receive 'em. And the reactions we've seen so far are exactly what we had hoped for:

updates.update_userinfo: Tripods, they are-a-shippin'. Plus, new bags.
updates.update_content:
We've got some neeeewwwwsssss...
But first, we owe you some tripod production footage from our latest factory visit. Over the past 2 months we've been working hand-in-hand with our contract manufacturers to ensure a smooth production and fulfillment ramp-up. Here are some scenes from that:

Join us now on YouTube! We've got Peter (Peak Design Founder & CEO), Tom (tripod engineer), Robb (tripod engineer), and David Barryreiser (physicist and expert tripod tester) online to go deep on your questions and comments!

updates.update_userinfo: LISTEN: You Already Know What You Are.
updates.update_content:
Hello.
All items have been received by us - with the exception of the bonus CD's, which will arrive soon - and we will ship packages within the next two weeks, as planned.
If you have any changes to your shipping information, or would like to add anything to your shipment, just get in touch. If you sent an email asking how to add a bonus CD or book to your shipment, we will be in touch shortly.

Before it's released on Friday, all backers of this project can hear "Believe Me" from Brutalism for Lovers today. Private link:
https://soundcloud.com/haloumusic/believe-me/s-O3ZUJ

Thank you for the response about the bonus album, "Los Angeles Will Kill You."
After looking into how best to do this within Kickstarter's limited framework, we've determined that direct PayPal will work easiest for everyone.
If your pledge already included the bonus CD, you don't need to do anything. If you'd like to add the bonus CD to your pledge/reward, simply PayPal $20 US to order@halou.com. This includes the additional shipping, etc.

Bonus CD:
We originally meant for the bonus CD to include demos and random bits for people that are into that sort of thing. After going through some files, we’ve decided that we will make it into a full companion album to BRUTALISM FOR LOVERS.
This companion album has been titled LOS ANGELES WILL KILL YOU and it will include eight new tracks that play like a fun house mirror version of BRUTALISM FOR LOVERS.
Some shots of the BRUTALISM FOR LOVERS promotional CD's. Cover art for this pressing features the image from the Disappointed single and is completely different than the actual album artwork.

campaign.story:
We engineered the GRIP6 Wallet with the determination to make it the quickest and most intuitive way to access and use your cards.  Simply squeeze and credit cards emerge, perfectly arrayed for immediate access.  Release your grip, and the cards drop down, locking in securely.
The wallet is beyond tough. We built and tested the wallet to last over 100 years.  The internal lift system is tested to well over 500,000 cycles (and going), the wallet is corrosion resistant and thoroughly impact-tested.  We construct it right here in Utah out of American aluminum, stainless steel, and high-strength polymer.  In other words, it will last you your lifetime, backed by our Industry leading “A3 Guarandamntee.”
The wallet comes optional with a high quality leather sleeve for those of us who are “minimalist-plus,”  allowing you to store cash or just more cards.  Without the leather jacket, the GRIP6 wallet feels strong, sleek, and space-age.  With the leather, the wallet feels more traditional, but maintains strength and quality.  We’ve also included the optional FingerLoop™ at no extra cost, which increases control, pocket access, and is fun to use. 
Made poorly and wear out quickly
Often bulky, thick and annoying
Difficult to access cards you need
Don't protect against RFID
The defining feature of the GRIP6 Wallet is the patent pending internal lift mechanism. With a simple squeeze, 6 cards emerge in an easy to retrieve stair step pattern.  This geometry leaves enough room between the cards for you to locate and grab the individual card you need. The cards can be put back in any order.
We spent a great deal of time testing and redesigning the wallet to last hundreds of thousands of cycles, simulating a century of use and abuse.  We don't believe in planned obsolescence.  We wanted a wallet to last longer than you. That may sound far-fetched, but it's true. We built a machine to cycle test the wallet half a million times before we stopped it, but it still hadn't broken. We took the wallet apart to see what damage had occurred, but almost none had; the wear was minimal. We feel really good about our final design and we think you'll love it.  You will be able to use your GRIP6 Wallet more than a dozen times per day, everyday, and it should last 105 years.  Because we're confident in our abilities and testing, we've also guaranteed them for life.
When you're not actively using the GRIP6 Wallet, the cards automatically remain locked in by a patent pending mechanism.  In addition, the light, durable 6061 T6 Aluminum body effectively blocks RFID (Radio Frequency Identification) signals used by the modern thief.  These features make sure the GRIP6 Wallet is both physically and electronically secure, and give you needed peace of mind.
We have a deep-seated belief that manufacturing is critical to the future of the United States' economy.  Many "Made in the USA" products are from materials and components from outside of the USA.  With the GRIP6 Wallet, we are able to source the high quality Aluminum, the top-grain Leather, and the glass bead-blasted injection molded plastic for the lever and internal lift mechanism all within the  USA.  The only thing we don't source within the USA are the stainless steel screws.  We're looking at bringing that home soon.
And it's not just made and sourced in the USA.  We cut and build the wallets right here in Utah, at our in-house manufacturing facility.  Owning the production process of a product also allows us to: 
Tightly control quality and consistency
Make minute process and redesign changes immediately
Incorporate customer feedback quickly
Provide fulfilling local jobs
Problem solve any issues that arise very quickly
We only use the best materials. The GRIP6 Wallet is wrought from 6061 T6 anodized aluminum, stainless steel screws, stainless steel springs, stainless steel pins and a high performance, glass bead-blasted, Bayblend® injection molded plastic. This wallet will withstand the toughest conditions and won't rust.
The FingerLoop™ was created to enhance your interaction with your wallet. The unique loop design makes it a cinch to pull the wallet out of your pocket. It ensures a more secure hold on the wallet and, most importantly, it's really fun!  You can flip your GRIP6 Wallet in your hand like a wild west gunslinger all day long and people around you will wonder, "What is that thing!? It's amazing! I want one!" But in all honestly, it really is both functional and fun.  We do caution you is that it's likely to annoy people how much you take your wallet out of your pocket to sling it around!
 The optional Leather Jacket gives your GRIP6 Wallet a softer, more traditional feel and provides expandability. It can hold both cards and cash and doubles the capacity of your wallet. The prototype leather covers are laser cut, but during full production they will be cut with a die on a clicker press (i.e., the leather will be clean and consistent).  They are then sewn on our "Boss" leather sewing machine that is capable of punching through 3/4" thick layers of leather or webbing. We will be converting the hand stitching machine into a fast, automated sewing machine for volume production.
The funds raised from this kickstarter will be used to purchase domestic plastic injection molds, all raw materials, equipment for cutting and sewing leather, and custom tooling for CNC machining the plates. We will literally be creating these unbelievable wallets with our own hands.  We've already done the hard work and know we'll be delivering you a one-of-a-kind product. We're excited to share the journey with you!
BJ Minson was a regular, back-pocket-wallet kind of guy for many years. But one day in a fit of minimalist indignation he pulled his sloppy, misshapen, hideous wallet out of his back pocket and asked himself, "Why in the world do I sit on this stupid thing all day?" 
So, he decided to put his cards in his front pocket and used a blue rubber band taken from a broccoli stem to hold them together. It was sooooo much better... for two weeks. Then the rubber brand broke. He bought more broccoli and a new rubber band, and the rubber band broke again.  This cycle happened several times. It wasn’t a bad setup: BJ was getting healthier eating all the broccoli and at least he didn’t have to deal with the ills of a regular wallet.  But it wasn’t perfect. 
Next, he purchased a thin, simple, card-holding wallet. It was good, but it was difficult to find the right card and even more difficult to get the card out, and the wallet fell apart too quickly. He bought a different one.  Rinse and repeat, the same thing happened. 
At the time BJ was studying mechanical engineering and he determined to design a better wallet. He got together with his friend Dan and over the course of several months developed the GRIP6 Wallet. 
At the time, BJ knew very little about manufacturing and the wallet was going to be fairly expensive to produce. He decided to give it a try on Kickstarter in 2012 with an audacious goal of $100,000.  Even with a sale price of more than $100, the wallet did surprisingly well and got almost halfway to the goal! But, sadly, ultimately did not fund. 
BJ went on to finish school, get a day job as an engineer, and kept his prototype wallet in his pocket for the next 7 years (yes, the original wallet still works fine). During that time, he designed and produced a new belt that was innovative, simple, and amazing. He launched it on Kickstarter in 2014 and it funded! BJ founded a company called GRIP6 (check out grip6.com for more info). He started in his garage with the help of friends and since that time has made hundreds of thousands of belts. 
GRIP6 grew quickly and steadily and has become a company that prioritizes and understands the value and complexity of in-house production and manufacturing efficiency.  Even as GRIP6 grew to be a leader in belts, BJ’s mind often wandered back to his beloved wallet, and he finally decided to bring his wallet to life. 
He and his team of engineers at GRIP6 have spent thousands of hours, exhausting their experience and ingenuity to make the wallet better, stronger, and much more economical. In honor of the birthplace of the original wallet and the GRIP6 name, BJ decided to bring it back to Kickstarter to give it new birth and to give the Kickstarter community the first opportunity to join the project and share the journey of bringing the wallet to full production.  
So - Thank you kickstarter community for giving us a start we couldn't have found anywhere else! We'll always be grateful to you.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are no strangers to manufacturing and the difficulties and problems that arise. We fully expect to run into challenges, but we have used our experience to mitigate foreseeable problems.

Here are a few of the tricks we use to execute projects like this:
 - use generous timeframes
 - overestimate the cost
 - plan for the worst case scenarios at every step
 - expect between a few and several unforeseen issues to arise
 - be a great problem solver
 - maintain regular communication with backers
 - be transparent


We'll get it all figured out and get you a great product. When we run into issues, we'll be transparent.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

https://grip6.com/pages/grip6-wallet-survey
(please take this survey if you have a moment)
Launching Tomorrow!
We're launching the GRIP6 Wallet on our website tomorrow, as I mentioned earlier.  If you need a Leather Jacket for your V1 Wallet (or V2) or another wallet or anything else, they will be available.

updates.update_userinfo: It's Over! We Shipped the last of the Kickstarter Wallets!
updates.update_content:
99.9% of Kickstarter Wallets Have Shipped!
This week we essentially wrapped up the Kickstarter campaign. As with any large project like this, there are a couple stragglers. There are a few countries currently refusing shipments from the U.S. (hopefully they open up soon). There are also about 15 orders left that are waiting for the last batch of green wallets. Our anodizers have been struggling and ruining a lot of wallet plates with some batches more than 20%. It's been a little frustrating. As a result, we had to send more small color batches at the end to get the final wallets finished off. Final 15 order will ship early next week.
Thank You All Very, Very Much!

Current Progress
We are steadily making progress. To date we have shipped 5126 wallets and we have 2414 to go. We are 68% done and moving faster than we have in past weeks. Our engineers and machinist took another look at our CNC program and tweaked it a bit to reduce the cycle times by about 30%. That means we are making more wallets each day in the same amount of time.

updates.update_userinfo: Still Manufacturing and Shipping! (Mid July Update)
updates.update_content:
Still Manufacturing and Shipping Wallets, But Slower Than Anticipated
I hate to say it, but this is taking longer than I said in the last update. As we have been producing the wallet parts and assembling the finished product, we have encountered quite a few small problems. While none of the problems seemed to present a major setback, collectively, they have added several weeks to our delivery timeline.

updates.update_userinfo: What to Expect video, Still Shipping (Mid June Update)
updates.update_content:
What To Expect Video
This is a quick video about what to expect from your new wallet when you get it. I just do a quick demonstration of the new improvements to the wallet and how it will work in real life.

updates.update_userinfo: V2.0 Wallet Shipments Started!!! (Late May Update)
updates.update_content:
Shipping Day Is Finally Here!
We actually started shipping wallets yesterday. Below is a picture of the first one! I manned the shipping station and shipped out about 25 wallets. It was a great feeling.

updates.update_userinfo: Testing V2.0 Production Wallets, Shipping Begins Next Week! And A Special Surprise.
updates.update_content:
All 3 Molds Are Done!
I have to give a shoutout to my engineering/machining team. We put a lot on our plates by bringing the injection molding in-house. It was incredibly difficult and pushed us to a new technical level. In particular, my machinist and my lead engineer have worked hard to get these wallets produced. They have solved all kinds of problems and worked hard. Thanks Austin and Amol. You guys are awesome.

updates.update_userinfo: Making progress on the Molds (mid-late April update)
updates.update_content:
Plastic Injection Molds, Most Technical Work Yet
When we decided to buy our own injection mold machine and make the molds ourselves, I was a little bit nervous. It was a fairly large project with a lot of unknowns. I was never nervous about not being able to figure it out, only about how much time it might add to the project. My nervousness was well founded.

Quick, Short update
I just wanted to do a quick update. We are still pressing forward on the production of the wallet. We are making progress on the molds, but having minor setbacks troubleshooting and trying to get the parts just right. We have our first mold finished and it is working well now. We learned a few things that should help us go faster on the other molds.

updates.update_userinfo: The GRIP6 Wallet V1.0 compared to V2.0 (Early March Update)
updates.update_content:
Sorry for the long silence. These updates take quite a bit of time and I've been focusing on making progress on the wallets. While it took time since the last update, just know that we have have not slowed our wallet efforts in any way. I'll get back to an every other week update next time. We've made a lot of progress and had some setbacks. As I promised last time, this update is mostly about how the V2.0 wallet is better than the V1.0.
V2.0 Redesign

campaign.story:
We're FEB  29.  In a nutshell, we design and craft awesome EDC designs at affordable prices.  With 3 successfully fulfilled campaigns, we bring you our 4th: Mjolnir 
and yes...we are huge fans of heroes!
Yes...we are worthy...*lol*


Feedback from > 6000 people survey can't be wrong, right? 
These are the top 4 essentials our respondents wanted in a wallet.
1.  Efficient Features
2.  Good Looks
3.  Affordable
4. Slim
If that's what our backers want, we'll make you guys a fxxxking great wallet. 
Just chuck in your loose change like how you receive them. Mjolnir would separate them into their respective places!
"Ejecting" has become our fidget hobby...
a "sticky" wallet is better than a missing wallet
SIM + SDHC + SIM TOOL SLOTS
immigration forms, cheques or even a love letter for that girl across your desk...maybe
Sticks to ferrometals & you get a instant phone stand!
safe for black magnetic strip technology, tested with most major bank atm cards too
Load Testing / tensile strength - btw we don't have any idea why we need our wallet to be stronger than steel...?
All wallet campaigns must have a picture of water sprayed on it... pretty much like a bikini model huh?
card ejector fits 10 cards without raised letters and 5 cards with. Hidden slot fits up to another 2.
NON RFID SHIELD AREA   =   CONVENIENT FOR QUICK TAP CARDS
RFID SHIELD AREA   =    SECURITY FOR YOUR CREDIT CARDS 
"Extremely functional for a slim wallet!  I fxxxking love it! "   - Alex Ferdinand, Stock Broker
"Love the unisex design and how it's so functional like a swiss army knife "   - Coleen  Gacia, Educator
"Perfect balance between functionality, aesthetics and affordibility! "   - Scott Easwood, Bartender 
"I got my hands on a early prototype 6 months ago & it's still working great! "   - Minny, Loyal kickstarter backer
       Just imagine the 'LIKES' you'll get from your 8 followers instagram account!  Impressive!
                     Looks so good that you just want to take it to bed.....sometimes....   


stretch goal options - p/s. MCU please let galactus and silver surfer join the fun! ;P
Galactus Black would offered as the base pledge level. 
Unlock Time Marine @ $20K  |  Soul Orange @$50k  |  Space Blue @$80k  |  Silver Surfer @$110k |  Reality Red @  $210k  |   Mind Yellow  @ $310k    |   Power Purple @ $410k   |       EU Friendly Shipping @ $444,444   |  Project "Giving Back"  @ $500,000  |                                     FREE "Vibranium" Tooth pick @ $ 1 Million  
Big enough for the huge 10,000 yen
We'll be showcasing cool add on options after the campaign ends hence shipping weight may change. Therefore, you will not need to pay for shipping yet until your order is finalized
To help achieve EU friendly shipping, we've decided to absorb the main bulk of the shipping related fees. However, we'll need to increase the subsidized rates to the EU by just $4 to $10 to help spread out the costs better.
EU Friendly Shipping would be a reality when we reach the stretch goal @ $444,444 =)
Why 'NO' to bulky + expensive wallets?
I thought it wouldn't happen to me and all the negative publicity about bulky wallets aggravating back/spine issues were just a hype to buy expensive slim wallets.
Well...it DID happened to me.
It took the surgeon a couple of hours of slicing and dicing to remove these spinal disc that were pressing on my nerves.
Actual pictures of my removed spinal disc and ops site. Yup, fxxxking bad experience..
I once had an EXPENSIVE smart tracking wallet too...
it was supposed to alert me when my wallet went out of bluetooth range,
until I found out that the bluetooth range can be from 10  to 91 metres.
and that's how my wallet got out of the bar without a squeak from the alarm.
Even if it rang earlier, I doubt I would have spotted the pickpocket with a room full of partying people...


"Hey, no sweat, I've got GPS tracking too, I'm going to track down this pickpocket!"
The tracker was working well, I tracked it to the trash bin a block down the street.
Now, I've got an EMPTY + SMELLY expensive smart wallet.
 Do you really an expensive smart wallet?  
We don't like paying for costly marketing agencies... We prefer to give back to our supporters...
                                 -  JUST HOW MUCH CAN MJOLNIR FIT? - 
So now....is mjolnir worthy for you?
         -  IMPROVED CARD SEAT = MINIMIZE CARD FALL OUTS - 
Why on Kickstarter?
We migrated from traditional mall retailing to Kickstarter because it gives us the 'freedom'  to run our small business exactly how we want.  No exorbitant rents, no expensive "contract" renovations, no expensive marketing, no hidden agendas which prevents us from giving our supporters the best value.
This means we can focus on doing what we love: designing & crafting the things to make your lives better.
This is our 4th Kickstarter project since 2016 and our supporters have steered the direction of our product development & design processes with their valuable feedback.  This symbiotic relationship between us, kickstarter and our supporters should be how the World be like.  A win-win for all.
Thank you for coming on this journey with us.  =)

OUR HUMBLE WORKSHOP
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With 3 successful campaigns fulfilled, this is our 4th Kickstarter campaign since 2016.

With the experience gathered, we are confident that we will be able to deliver on our promises. Even if things goes southwards, we promise to give you full transparency and solve them in a way that leaves our backers happy and proud to support us.

Manufacturing Risk: Along the supply chain, our part suppliers may run out of raw materials, sometimes something along the way breaks and takes a couple of days to fix. These things happen from time to time and can affect how long it takes to craft our products. Should the response by overwhelming, production & shipping would be done in batches and delivery dates would be extended accordingly.
There maybe slight variation of colors during manufacturing, if it is not within our tolerance or not manufactured by the fabric factory, we will remove the stretch goal color selection and offer another color option for our backers.

Shipping Risk: Shipping world wide is no easy feat. Our experienced fulfillment partners would do their best. If you live down the dust path in the middle of nowhere, do allow more time for your pledge to reach you.

Design: We are constantly fine tuning our designs hence Mjolnir maybe delivered to you with changes / upgrades which may not be reflected in our kickstarter page

Legal & Political Risk: If someone powerful somewhere increases tax or tariffs that we are unable to absorb, we'll need to spread that cost to bring mjolnir to life. We've done our due diligence to the best of our abilities to minimize any legal liability, we'll update our backers if any pops up along the way. No matter what, we'll get through it together. 


Duty/VAT charges: “In this world, nothing can be said to be certain except Death and Taxes” - Benjamin Franklin. Do check with your local customs & tax office.

Expectations: We want our backers to experience helpful designs at affordable prices. We know nothing is perfect and we will constantly improve our designs with the feedback that backers give us.
It may not be perfect but it's still a fxxxking great wallet!

Thanks & shoutouts:
Thanks to Truxillogical for your awesome chibi avengers drawings. =)
Our prototype testers - thank you for your feedback - you helped us make a fxxxking great wallet!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Almost all Indian green cardamom (organically certified or not) is sprayed with pesticides and fertilizers between 10-30x before harvest. We spent over a year sourcing 100% pesticide-free, heirloom cardamom that met our high standards of taste, quality and sustainability, and we’re finally ready to share it with you!
$25,000 allows us to purchase the entire 400 lb 2019 spring harvest, and package it in our beautifully redesigned recycled glass jars.
 Anything we make over $25k, will go towards purchasing milling equipment, sourcing Coorgi rainforest pepper, Gujarati sea salt, Rajasthani desert cumin and regional chill peppers from Karnataka and Andhra, coming end 2019!  
This cardamom has been a long time coming...
I first tried to source organically farmed Indian green cardamom in the spring of 2018. I called all my contacts at the Indian Institute of Spice Research and the Indian Cardamom Research Institute (ICRI), and put the word out amongst my network of South Indian farmers and their communities. 
By summer 2018, I collected samples from several certified organic cardamom growers, but heard a very concerning story from the spice research community. Dr. Vijayan, a trusted resource and the deputy director of research at ICRI, bluntly explained to me how big commercial cardamom growers cheat the organic certification process to sell pesticide-ridden cardamom labeled as organic to the global market. Sure enough, every single lab result for the samples I received came back positive for pesticides.
Just when I had given up on sourcing pesticide-free cardamom, I got a call from Mr. Abraham Chacko- a farmer bang the middle of the cardamom hills- the region where commercial and corrupt cardamom agriculture is at its worst. Shockingly, his sample came back 100% pesticide free. I booked a flight to visit him the next day. 
Abraham started farming over 20 years ago on his family estate with little success. In 2017, after adopting a new low-budget biodynamic farming method, he noticed some of his cardamom plants were faring much better than the rest. He began to selectively breed the older, hardier plants bearing healthy fruit and withstanding the pests that usually devastate organic cardamom. 
The resulting cardamom seeds are fruity, incredibly potent, with a lasting fragrance. I could already imagine the kadak, spicy cups of chai, or the aromatic, heady pastries we could make with them! 
From left: The Princess (50g) and The Queen (100g)
Abraham has tried to sell his cardamom at the local auction house for years, but commodity cardamom is chosen based on size and color alone, factors that have no relation to their taste or quality. His paler, smaller pods fetch a low price, and since the auction houses are usually financed in some part by pesticide and fertilizer companies, there is no market for anything grown organically.
The commodity price of cardamom is 15x the price of every other spice on the Indian spice market. After saffron and vanilla, it's the third most expensive spice in the country. So naturally, it is a game of big players with big cash, and whilst we're a small player with small cash we've always had big dreams, big impact, and big community :) 
 WHO WE ARE: 
Diaspora Co. was founded in August 2017 to disrupt and decolonize the spice supply chain. Our first offering, a high-curcumin, freshly-milled, heirloom turmeric called Pragati, was born out of the idea that if turmeric was going to explode and have its "moment" in the U.S., we wanted to make sure that it was sourced equitably, transparently and sustainably. We've since become known as the highest standard of turmeric in the U.S., used in your favorite turmeric latte brands, restaurant menus and in over 15k homes across the country. 
Our business promise is to pay our partner farms between 2x-10x the commodity price (more on that below), and source the freshest, heirloom, single-origin spices from India. You can read our entire founding story here.
NICE THINGS PEOPLE HAVE SAID:  
 "Compared to the turmeric you get in the grocery store, it's night and day. You need to know about this organically-farmed, single-origin turmeric." - Food & Wine
"Diaspora turmeric is brighter and warmer tasting, with a stronger smell. It also doesn't hurt to know we're supporting farmers with a fair and living wage."  - Cooking Light
"Best Decolonized Food Company of 2018" - East Bay Express
And more...
PRESS KIT: 
You can access our press kit including logos, photographs and video here. 
 REWARDS:    
 Cardamom - The Princess (50g) and The Queen (100g): 
Harvested: 2/2019, Best By: 2/2020 
Turmeric - Lil' Goldie (70g) and The Essential Gold (140g)
Harvested: 2/2019, Milled: 3/2019, Best By: 3/2021 
The Queen (100g) and Cooking with the Queen Zine ft. our favorite cardamom recipes!
The Duo - Princess (50g Cardamom) & Lil Goldie (70g Turmeric)
The Good Goods Gift Basket
Raaka Chocolate - A pioneer in transparently traded cacao, Raaka Chocolate was one of the companies that set the standard for how we wanted to do business. Making incredibly delicious chocolate helps too. 
One Stripe Chai Co. - In a sea of terrible chai, One Stripe Chai Co. is making store-bought chai delicious again, and sourcing equitably to boot!
Bean Voyage Coffee - Women-powered coffee that collaborates directly with smallholder coffee farmers in Costa Rica to grow, harvest and roast their own beans. Taking back ownership of a colonial supply chain, one cup of coffee at a time!
The Indian-ish Cook's Essentials
Brooklyn Delhi - Bringing delicious, natural Indian condiments to the grocery stores that taste as delicious on pizza as on dal-chawal, we truly couldn't go a day with this stuff. 
Indian-ish - Priya Krishna's bestselling book that is about to become a classic - featuring family style home cooking from her Indian-American kitchen. 
Diaspora Marigold Apron -  Hand-embroidered on organic cotton canvas and featuring a completely adjustable fit!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've already imported the cardamom to the United States, and getting it here was truly the hardest part, so that's done!

We'll be working with a family owned co-packer in Tracy, CA to package this entire harvest, which is different from how we've usually done things, but we're confident in their abilities and ours to get them everything they need to do a great job!

Our biggest concern is that we only have so much cardamom, and won't have more until the end of 2019, so stock up now! This is a very, very limited drop of the good stuff!

updates.update_userinfo: Rewards Update: Thank you!, Addresses, and More!
updates.update_content:
We're sending out all rewards this week, so you should be receiving your goodies as early as next week! HURRRRAAAAAY!!!! Thank you so, so much once again :) 
One issue we ran into was with our zines :( The recipes were unfortunately printed wrong, and we're having to re-print the entire lot. This means that zines are still 3+ weeks away, we're so sorry! They'll be mailed to you separately, in a bright yellow envelope. You'll hear from us more about that once the time comes, don't worry!

updates.update_userinfo: Cardamom is here! Rewards go out this week! One little hitch...
updates.update_content:
We raised $57,865 for Diaspora Cardamom which is 231% of our initial goal!!! Thank you, thank you, thank you. 
I'm writing this update from Kolkata airport, having just spent the past few days in Shillong, Meghalaya  meeting some really special and fiesty black cardamom, ginger, and turmeric farmers! 
Tonight I'm headed down south to source pepper, chillies and a few other surprises for the next three weeks! This is 100% because y'all believed in our little spice dream enough to get us here, and give us the $$$ to make this happen.

With 10 days to go, we're blown away by your support. Thank you. Truly. SO CLOSE TO $55K!
We've had so many emails + messages over the last few days asking... "well cardamom is well and good, but where's the 2019 harvest of turmeric?!". 
So we added two new reward levels just for you: 
1. For the straight up turmeric fans - The Gold Reward - $31 (140g Turmeric + Cooking with Gold Zine at 16% off retail) is for you!

Thank you, thank you, thank you to the 500+ humans who rallied for us in less than 36 hours to make this happen!!! Our stretch goal is $55,000, which will go directly towards sourcing black pepper, sea salt, cumin, and a variety of regional Indian chili peppers! Each spice costs us approx. $15k to source, so if we get to $55k - you’ll be seeing at least two new spices from us as early as this fall! In a magical world we’ll get to $85k and it’ll be raining direct trade spices all year long #justsayin ;) Once again, thank you for your support and generosity, we are all so so grateful to be in community with you all.

We sold out of all 100 early bird pledges in 34 minutes?! Thank you, thank you. I am over here refreshing the page in awe and low key shaking. 
Luckily we still have a good amount of Late Bird (16% off retail!) pledges to go, so go wild!
In community,
Sana (Chief Feelings Officer)

campaign.story:
The Pioneer celebrates innovation for positive change - Become a Pioneer and help us create a better future through sustainability
The Nordgreen take on the Chronograph is a celebration of the Danish tradition of Science for Humanity, a concept established to create positive change for humankind and nature, thus celebrating the sustainable future that we dream of.
We as Danes are proud to be one the Pioneer's in sustainability, and through the Chronograph we are inviting others on a journey for a better future.
The clean space around the dial is a reflection of the environment that we want to live in, while the third hand stopwatch (Chrono second hand), which has a red tip inspired by windmills, is a reminder of the bond between Nordgreen and the sustainability of its motherland.
The watch comes in three dial colors - blue, black, and white - and three case colors - gun metal, silver and rose gold.
The Native remodeled brings with it domed glass, transparent minute marks, as well as the new 32mm Native Lille
Jakob has re-imagined the Native which is inspired by Copenhagen and the unpretentiousness of the Danish way of life.
The re-modeled Native comes with invisible minute marks, because in Copenhagen, we don’t count the minutes, we enjoy quality time. We also bring you the Native Lille, a smaller 32 mm version for the female audience, in addition to the existing 36mm and 40mm watch faces. The new models will be available with white, blue and black dials, as well as a new gold and gunmetal case option, adding to the current silver and rose gold case colors.
With every watch you are able to swap your straps out with a different one, allowing you to define how your express yourself and your outfits. Simply detach the straps on your watch, and you are ready to change to any style you are in the mood for. 
Jakob Wagner is an award-winning designer with over 25 years of experience, working with the likes of Bang & Olufsen, Hay and Muuto. Nordgreen’s sustainable approach was one of the core reasons he chose to work with us: “What has become really important to me is to work solely on something… on conscious projects; ones that mean sustainability is a given. To make something that has intrinsic value and that we want to keep for a long time.”  
Nordgreen Team In Copenhagen
Since launch, The Nordgreen team has grown from just a handful of people to employ over 20 internationals. Our office of more than 30 employees, is carbon-neutral, with 90% of employees opting to cycle to work. Our co-founders, Vasilij Brandt and Pascar Sivam are university friends and watch enthusiasts who envisaged one day owning a business together, a dream made true by the Kickstarter community.
We expect to deliver by mid-October. Incentives our goal is achieved, we’ll work tirelessly with our manufacturers to get you your package as soon as possible.
Hello all, 
We are Vasilij and Pascar, the founders of Nordgreen, and we are back again hoping to bring you something even bigger and better than last year. 
Since we launched on Kickstarter last year we have gone on to sell over 10,000 watches in over 70 countries. 
We owe a big thanks to you and the Kickstarter community, we really couldn’t have done it without you!
In collaboration with our chief designer Jakob Wagner we bring you two new models, on our mission to make Scandinavian design accessible to all, while promoting global sustainability. We hope that you will love the new range as much as we do.
We would be so grateful if you chose to support us again this time around, and join us on our journey.
Much love
Pascar and Vasilij
Is there a warranty and how long is it?
Yes, all watches purchased through the Kickstarter are covered by an exclusive 3-year warranty
How can I select my watch and strap combination?
When the Kickstarter campaign is over, we will send you a survey where you can choose the specific colors
Can I add an extra strap?
Once the survey has been sent, you will be able to add-on extra items
Can I change my order?
During the campaign you can adjust your order / pledge at anytime. 
When should I expect to receive the watch?
We will ship the watches from Denmark in the middle of October
Having any other questions?
Please contact hello@nordgreen.com and we will be more than happy to help you with anything!
If you live outside of the EU, you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges. NOTE: While we wish we could help get our packages to you faster, we have no control over custom processing times. USA WILL NOT be subject to import taxes and charges
This campaign is promoted by Backercamp. Since 2012, Backercamp has helped 5,000+ creators make their projects a reality, raising over $250MM through crowdfunding. 
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 650+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $300MM raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Delivery time: There is always a risk that our suppliers do not deliver on time, however we are confident that we will be able to meet our October delivery schedule. 

Customs: There are some countries which may encounter some issues. This is not relevant for the EU, JP, AU, SG, HK, UK, MY and US.

We'll update you regularly on progress, and if there are any issues along the way, we'll let you know!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
Thank you to everyone that has shared their feedback so far, we are so happy that you all (most ;)) love your watches.
We are pleased to say that all orders have now been shipped, except for a few due to exceptional circumstances.

Dear Backers
Thank you for your patience over the last week while we got out the next batch of orders.
The update is as follows:
1) As per the last update, all express orders have been shipped. However, there were a number of orders which had some address errors which have caused delays. These have now been fixed and uploaded to our warehouse system, however, they have not been dispatched yet. This will be done early next week.

Dear Backers,
We have some more news regarding the shipments - 
1) We had some queries from some backers in the previous update who did not receive their tracking links despite selecting the express option. This is due to a number of address errors (roughly 150), which meant that we had to manually re-process these. They are being rectified as we speak and should be dispatched early next week.

Dear Backers,
We are happy to announce that all express shipments went out on Monday & Tuesday. You should receive an email with the tracking details shortly if you haven't already.
The rest of the shipments are being dispatched today and tomorrow. You will receive tracking links once they have done so.

updates.update_userinfo: PLEASE READ! Final chance to make shipping amendments...
updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
We are right on track to begin shipping your orders over the next few days. We have our team in the warehouse working all weekend to make sure that you get your watches on time.
Once your order has been shipped next week you will receive a shipping confirmation with a tracking link.

Dear backers,
We have some exciting news for you all - your watches are due to arrive in our warehouse by the end of the week, at which point we will be packing them over the weekend, ready to ship them out to you next week. 
This means that you will most likely receive your watch by the 25th of October, and at the latest the end of the month. Please do not worry if you see other people posting their feedback prior you receiving yours before the end of the month. However, if the 1st November comes and you are yet to receive your order, then please contact us via email to hello@nordgreen.com so that we can get back to you within a matter of hours. Please do not post delivery queries on Kickstarter as we may miss them. We want to make sure that your responses are resolved quickly.

To our dear backers,
We hope that you have all had a wonderful summer, or whatever season it may be wherever you are in the world. We've been fortunate in being able to spread the brand far and wide across the globe with our Kickstarter and IndieGoGo campaigns. As a small brand it is incredibly exciting to see our products touch every corner of the world, and it's thanks to all 3,008 of you. You are making our dreams come true in building a global business which is not simply just a product, but one that is trying to do some good in the world.

Dear all backers
We wanted to give you a quick update, because we have not sent out any communications in the last few weeks, to let you know that we are on course to deliver your watches still in October, as promised.
We can't wait to hear your feedback!

campaign.story:
Nothing…and I mean nothing is as frustrating as watching the freshly-cleaned vegetables and fruits you just rinsed fall into the sink AFTER you’ve rinsed them. Even worse, if you don’t have a good grip on your items, they can ALL fall back into the sink – taking your sanity with them.
The Equilibric colander reduces the amount of water needed to wash your fruits and vegetables by 60% - all while removing twice as many contaminants! You will never have to worry about items in the sink again because this design saves you time and frustration.
Its ergonomic design keeps the vegetables upright and safe as the water bowl drains the dirty water away, cleaning your foods and keeping your clean items safe from spillage.

The colander also serves as a great serving dish for you.  You don’t have to worry about using more dishes than necessary just because you need something to put them in afterwards.  Drain the excess water from your vegetables - and serve your fruits or salads in the same dish.
Trying to defrost something at room temperature turns into a huge problem for most cooks.  Water often winds up all over the counter creating an even bigger mess, and more work for you.
With typical colanders, lots of dirt and other contaminates can transfer to your clean serving dishes.  But with the Equilibric colander, its washing machine motion helps remove 90% of the dirt and bacteria from your foods – giving you a healthier, more nutrient rich meal!
As you can see, the Equilibric colander saves you time and energy.  It’s also incredibly efficient, sanitary, and environmentally conscious.  Moreover it saves extra money on your water bill.
Equilibric has a very well considered hole slots pattern that allows to drain the excess water fast and simple. Equilibric Bowl is made from a high quality polypropylene which is an unharmful material to dine from. Equilibric Bowl design has a special spin system which uses the force of gravity to speed up all kitchen tasks.





Story. Team. Development. Future.
My name is Ann and I’ve been working in design for eight years. I’ve graduated twice and worked my way from the position of a common designer to art director. My husband Tim is an engineer and likes inventing. Together we’ve come up with Equilibric.
Me and Tim were born in the countryside, and despite growing up in an urban area, we always preferred home food over fast food l, which bears no benefit or proper nutrients, often being harmful. So we cook home a lot and try to ease doing so process as much as possible.
Four years ago I had the idea to improve the typical colander design, after having bought all kinds of them in stores, inspired by design of various items and inventions, from spoons to airplanes. So I took a pencil and got to draw.

Thanks to Tim, my sketches and concepts came to life as working prototypes.


The most problematic part was talking to various China-based factories. We were sending the design and info over, but struggled with communication problems. But ultimately, we found a manufacturer and a manager that helped us on this stage after it had stretched on for a while.
Two years ago, Sabina joined us as a co-founder, responsible for communications and marketing. Without her, we wouldn’t have been able to make it to Kickstarter and organize everything.
We’re really grateful to Inpixel, the company that took care of the video material for us, delivering calmly great results despite my quite extensive list of requests.
Our future plans is to introduce a brand new type of colander for enthusiasts and kitchen professionals. I promise, you haven’t seen anything like it before, and we’ll be showcasing it on Kickstarter right from the concept stage! We’re also creating a USB-powered heating food container, which might possible have its own battery.
Our global goal is to create a brand of smart kitchen gadgets and food containers (both with and without heating) for carrying your dishes.
Please help us bring our plans to life, and become part of Equilibric!

TIMELINE

April 24, Project ends
May 8, Receiving funds from Kickstarter
May 9 - July 10, Mass production
July 10-20, Quality control
July 20-25, Shipping to the fulfilment and logistics centre
July 26, Shipping out
End of August, All backers receive their Equilibric

campaign.story:
Modern minimal carry, is the basis to everything we set out to create. This time around, we wanted to design a more minimal pen that's sleek and pocket friendly. By incorporating the highest quality materials with subtle design elements, we were able to create a full size feel in a compact form factor. Whether you're in the board room or out in the field, the EP1 is the essential EDC pen for any occasion.
We designed the REFYNE EP1 around the Schmidt easyFLOW 9000 refill because we love the way it writes. Smooth and easy. Also, we knew that by choosing this style refill, it would allow users to swap out to literally dozens of other options because our pen works with any standard parker style refills (list of refills below). Who doesn’t like variety, right?
Featuring a unique shaped bolt action channel, the bolt action mechanism was chosen for its simplicity and ease of deployment. With the flick of your finger you can open or close the pen in a fraction of a second. We decided to add a subtle design element, by using copper for the internal barrel. 
Depending on your carry preferences, the sleek deep carry pocket clip can be easily removed with the turn of a screw. The integrated top cap allows this to be done seamlessly without showing any unsightly holes or notches when the clip is taken off. Additionally, the clip is keyed to keep it secure and in position. 
Each screw has been custom machined and accepts a standard Torx T6 bit. This makes tightening down the bolt or removing the pocket clip both effortless and secure.
Dimensions: 115mm x 10mm (4.53" x 0.39")
Polished Titanium body: 24g (0.88oz)
Black PVD Coated Stainless Steel body: 36g (1.23oz)
Removable Custom deep carry pocket clip
Copper Barrel Bolt-Action
Black Schmidt easyFLOW 9000 M refill (included)
Compatible with most Parker style refills
Custom Torx T6 hardware

campaign.story:
LifeStraw® Home is a 7-cup glass water filter pitcher with sleek design and next Level filtration tested to protect against bacteria, parasites, microplastics, lead, mercury, cadmium, chromium III, copper and a variety of chemicals including pesticides, herbicides and chlorine. 
At LifeStraw, we’ve been bringing safe water to outdoor adventurers, travelers and communities in need for over a decade. Our products are in use in over 60 countries and are regularly used to provide safe drinking water during disaster relief efforts worldwide. Our mission is to make water safe for everyone and in recent years, we’ve seen increasing evidence of contaminants such as microplastics, lead, and chemicals within tap water in the US. Instances of boil water advisories have continued to increase as hurricanes and other natural disasters have compromised drinking water infrastructure. With all this in mind, we set a goal to create a household water filter pitcher that would provide the ultimate protection against all of these contaminants (and more!), while also vastly improving on design. No more ugly plastic water pitchers hiding in your refrigerator! And oh yeah, the water tastes pretty good too - whether its from your tap, or a river in the backcountry.
SPECIFICATIONS
Weight: 2.4 lbs | 1.1 kg
Dimensions: 11.2 x 6.4 in |  285 x 163 mm
Filter size: 4.7 in | 119 mm
Meets NSF 53 standard for reduction of lead, mercury, chromium III and Cadmium 
Meets NSF 42 standard for chlorine reduction 
Meets US EPA drinking water standards for bacteria and parasites
We went through many rounds of design in collaboration with our partner, Soren Rose Studio to achieve our main objective: a beautifully designed pitcher, easy to clean and easy to use with the most powerful filtration technology.
STRETCH GOAL - Help us get to 75k!!!
We decided to create a STRETCH GOAL of $75,000! If we hit this goal, we will offer new colors (to ship in JUNE) of the LifeStraw Home - including Aqua and Gray. This stretch target will not only provide you with more options, but will increase access to safe water - both domestically and globally. Help us reach this new target by spreading the word!

 It’s aesthetically amazing as well as efficient.  Read Article
One product, one child, one year of clean water.
Giving back is at the heart and soul of the LifeStraw DNA. When you support LifeStraw products, you help us provide safe water to school children all over the world.

 A special thanks to our collaborator, Soren Rose Studio
 Also grateful for the help of Adam Barker Photography and Harry Yuan of Double H Production for showcasing the beauty and functionality of this product.

campaign.story:
History
In 2015, when I crafted the original Tidashi from a rough piece of Titanium stock, I had felt the urge to step away from my computer and design something in a different way. With the use of basic tools, a simple design emerged from my hands.  A small and tactile object that has proven to be more useful in everyday life than I had expected. Along with many of the original adopters, I still use this little cutting tool on a daily basis. It really has withstood the test of time.
Clear and Cloudy
Rainbow and Midnight
The shape and name of the Tidashi is derived from a traditional Japanese utility knife, called Kiridashi-Kogatana; a design recognized by its long handle and short cutting edge. In Japan this tool is still relied upon for making accurate cuts or markings on wood. 
EDC
Reiteration
Over the years, Tidashi users have provided me with feedback. A slight size increase has often been suggested, and I am glad to say that that is exactly what the Tidashi 2.0 is offering, resulting in a more confident grip when using the tool. 
Evolution
A redesigned and more substantial silicone sheath provides just the right amount of friction for securely holding and releasing the Tidashi. It also allows for the use of larger diameter paracord and keyrings, both of which are included. It is still made from the same long lasting silicone material which has held my personal original Tidashi for all these years.
Dimensions
True to its origins, the Tidashi 2.0 is cut from grade 5 titanium, known for its toughness and corrosion resistance. It is often used in diving knives, as it is lighter than steel and able to resist even the harsh environment of salt water. The fact that this particular alloy lends itself to easy sharpening is something that I have found useful, but not essential to the Tidashi design. It is not a tool for slicing tomatoes. The blade length is simply too short for that. Its forte lies in puncturing and shallow cuts, as done when opening packages. And of course its biggest strength, as with any tool, is the fact that its size allows you to have it on you when you need it. 
Always with you
Emergence
In order to increase the manufacturing accuracy and consistency of this new iteration of the Tidashi, I have decided to have its basic shape cut by CNC. This will allow me to focus more on the final finish of the Tidashi, including a unique anodizing method for bringing out the amazing colors of the natural titanium oxide layer that covers any titanium object.
Colors...
The decision to relinquish absolute control over the original Tidashi design by walking away from my computer, is also what guided me in developing a new coloring method for the Tidashi 2.0. I tried to put emphasis on naturally occurring patterns. By subtly controlling the flow of acid and electricity along the surface of the Tidashi, I was able to bring out some unique shapes and colors reminiscent of the cloudy skies over my home in the Sierra Nevada mountains. Although the process is repeatable, no two knives with this pattern will be exactly the same, just like the skies.  I was also able to recreate the original color combinations such as Rainbow and Midnight for a total of ten unique versions for you to choose from. I am showing all ten variations here, but please scroll all the way down for some more info about the new storage pouch.
1.Natural
2.Clouds
3.Midnight
4.Acid
5.Rainbow Black
6.Rainbow White
7.Sky
8.Black Gold
9.White Gold
10.Purple Rain
Packaging
In the past I have often spent a lot of time and energy on the packaging of my designs. And although a custom box for your Tidashi would be nice, I was recently confronted with the sheer amount of waste I was producing by doing this. In response I have decided to package the Tidashi 2.0 in a more permanent and reusable zippered Cordura pouch. It is lined in a soft plush material to protect your Tidashi not only during shipping, but also if you should choose to store it. The design in not finalized yet, but it will most likely be just like in the picture below.
Storage pouch included
Experience
After having fulfilled several campaigns and having shipped thousands of rewards, I would consider myself a veteran Kickstarter creator. I very much consider the Kickstarter experience a shared one between myself and the backers, which is why I am always very open about the project in regular updates. I also try to answer any and all questions asked in messages and in the comment section. My backers and I have traveled this path from inception to completion several times, and we have seen the highs and lows along the route. The previous project has been especially hard, and it has shown me which pitfalls to avoid in future endeavors, including the project we are embarking on now. I hope you will join us, and make the Tidashi 2.0 project another successful one. 
Cheers,
Sander
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If there is one thing I have learned from my previous project, it is how the complexity of a design can exponentially increase the risk of something going wrong during production. It is the main reason why I chose to keep this design as simple as the original design. It is also why I chose to keep the anodizing process in house. It is a process too delicate to hand off. 

The process of manufacturing the basic shape of the Tidashi 2.0 is done by an overseas manufacturer I have worked with in the past. They have been reliable and based on the samples they provided (which are in the pictures you see here) I believe they will provide an excellent product. As the project is going live we are discussing some final details about the cutting process and final finish of the shape. I plan to perform a thorough quality control on the initial small production runs, before increasing the production volume. And if for whatever reason the manufacturer cannot continue production, I can always fall back on the equipment I acquired for making the original Tidashi, and move production in house. 

The mold used for creating the silicone sheath has already been made and paid for, because I wanted to show you the result in the pictures. This means that production of the sheaths should not be the bottle neck in this project.

The pouch design is based on an existing design, and the manufacturer has indicated that it is comfortable making it. If problems should arise with the manufacturing, I would not have a problem reverting to the exact design that the manufacturer already makes on a regular basis (the only difference is a slightly different size). 

I will be shipping the Tidashis anywhere in the world from the US, and although the declared value of the average shipment will be below the duty threshold of most countries, there is a chance that you will have to pay some import duties, especially on larger shipments. If you have ever ordered anything from abroad, you are probably already aware of this, and know that I have no control over this, other than keeping the declared value to a minimum.
 
Although the cutting edge of the Tidashi is very short, I want every backer to be aware that there is always the possibility that the laws of your country do not allow you to carry it in public. As far as I am aware, it has never happened in the past. 

In summary, I believe that the biggest risk would be delay in the expected delivery date. The reason for this is that definitive information about production quantities will not be available until after the campaign closes. This is a problem that is almost inherent to the Kickstarter system, and we'll work with it.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
