updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone,
It has been a week since the start of the CIZOR campaign, and I am very happy to see that so many of you have joined.
When designing a knife or other product, there are always many iterations that precede the final production model. Early prototypes are often not functional as they are made by hand or by 3d printing from plastic or wood. However, later iterations are functional, but are perhaps slightly different from the final product. Of this last category of prototypes I have accumulated quite a few over the years. I have experimented with materials and processes, and rarely discarded the results.

Hello Everyone,
Happy Thanksgiving to those celebrating. Hope you are having a wonderful day with family and friends.
Most of you should have received your Tidashis (a few might still be en route). I am very grateful for the positive feedback many of you have provided.

Hello Everyone,
As I am about to ship out the first of the rewards, I wanted to share a few pictures showing the progress made. I have been anodizing all the different colors, one Tidashi at a time. It is time consuming but gratifying work.

Hello Everyone,
It has been a hectic month. Lots of parts have been delivered and I am currently preparing to anodize the first batch of knives that came in.
A few days ago the cords with caps came in, I was very curious how they turned out, and I am happy to say the factory did a great job. At the last minute I was even able to color match the safety break away to the color of the cap on each cord. Those little details...

Hello Everyone,
We literally have been shaken up a little in this part of the world. Luckily nothing more than some waves in the fish tank and lamps swinging from the ceiling for us, but I hear it’s not so minor for people closer to the epicenter of these recent rumblings of the earth. 
Thought I'd do a quick update on the progress of the project. As mentioned before, all the parts are currently in production and some are already finished. Last week the shipment of silicone stands arrived. Funny how it was the last part I worked on and it is the first one finished.

Hello Everyone,
Well, it took a while, but the survey is finally complete. The stand prototypes arrived a few days ago, so I was able to include them. Here's a picture of the grey ones.

Hello Backers old and new,
You are now officially part of the Tidashi 2.0 project, so welcome. I am glad and very grateful that you have decided to join the campaign. I am also happy that the fundraising part is now over and we can move on to the next phase. Let me explain the timetable to give you some insight.
Over the next few weeks Kickstarter will collect the pledges from you. While that is ongoing  I will be preparing the survey. Many of you have already asked to change their pledge to include color or extra items, and I am happy to say that the survey should accomodate such changes and more.

project_data.project_name: Tidashi 2.0, a titanium mini knife

campaign.story:
Tired of always struggling items that need to be packed, and there's never enough room?  
No matter where we go...you could be flying somewhere for a family vacation, traveling on business, going on a camping trip, or even just heading to the beach, there are always items that need to be packed, and we’re never able to fit them all!
Does this look familiar?
Well, let us introduce you to the ultimate travel companion...

Revolutionary vacuum is smaller than an iPhone X with more power than other products
Pacum is the most powerful, multi-functional, handheld vacuum & air pumping device in the world... 
For its size, it packs a mighty punch with capabilities of compressing items 25% more than the other brand's  vacuum, and 4x faster than any device in its class.  Pacum will compress a vac bag full of clothes in just over a minute!
Take It Here.  Bring It There.  Pacum Can Go Anywhere.
Seriously though...For being as small as it is, Pacum packs a mighty punch!  About half the size of an iPhone X, you can bring Pacum ANYWHERE, in ANYTHING, making it your new essential travel tool. 
The Meaning of Convenience
Here at Pacum, we believe in convenience.  We know that remembering everything before you leave on a trip can be difficult.  The last thing you want to do is worry about what will, or will not fit in your suitcase, or whether or not you finished vacuum packing that last bag... 
That's why we made Pacum AUTOMATIC, with an intelligent design that's very easy to use!
✔  Panel lights indicate the function setting
✔  2 pump modes. "eco-mode" & "supermode"
✔  Pacum stops automatically
✔  Double your packing capacity in just over 1 minute
Check it out! ⬇
The Most Versatile Multi-functional Device On The Market
So you think Pacum is just a vacuum?  Think again!
Not only can it take the air out, but it can PUMP AIR IN!
Going to chill out at the pool?  Pacum will blow up you inflatables...
Your kids need to blow up some basketballs before practice?  Boom.  We got you!
Adaptable & Compatible
So, you already have some vacuum bags at home?  No problem! 
Pacum comes with our brand vacuum bags & accessories, but you will also be equipped with our "Padaptor", making any existing vacuum bags you own compatible with Pacum! 
Here's a closer look at the Padaptor...
With your order on Kickstarter you will receive at least one of each of the following items:
✔  Pacum Device
✔  Padaptor
✔  Pacum Bag
✔  USB Type-C Line
✔  Inflatable accessories ( 3 accessories in each pack )
Powering Your Pacum you have to do is plug it in using your wall charger or portable power bank!
What Can Pacum Compress?
Food Storage Bag
Pacum Bag
Other Brand Vacuum Bags
Pacum Bag Protection
Travel is fun, but what are you going to do when you need to carry all the dirty, sweaty clothes you wore during the trip? The Pacum bag takes care of this annoying problem, keeping them vac-packed away from odor and bacteria. 
Pacum Testing
Pump Air Out
Pump spent about 1:50 mins to compress a DOWN jacket. 
PLAY

Pump AIR In
PLAY



Pacum FAQ
Question: May I know what is the power input requirement? 
Answer: Pacum uses the USB Type-C as connector. Pacum requires a power input equal to 5v/2a or above. It is the common output for portable power bank / Wall charge point. 
Question: What is the size and weight for Pacum 
Answer: Pacum Size is as below Height:86mm width:43mm depth:43mm Weight : ~145g only 
Question: How long does it take for Pacum to finish compressing a pacum bag? Answer: It depends on the quantity of clothing inside our bag. Our tests show the followint results: 5 Tees, 1 Hoody,1 Pant, took about 50s – 70s 4 Jeans, took about 70s-90s 2 Down Jackets, took about 90s-120s 
Question: How many clothes can put into the Pacum bags? 
Answer: Below is the table of our test result, for you reference only. It would vary depending on the size of clothes. T-shirt /Dress 6 – 8 / Hoody 3 – 4 / Sweater 3 – 4 / jeans 3 – 4 / Down Jacket * 1 – 2 
Question: Is Pacum noisy during its operation? 
Answer: Absolutely not, Pacum would is quiet during its operation. We have measured the level of noise and is just <60db. 
Question: What is the size of Pacum bags? 
Answer: The size of Pacum bags is 50 cm*50 cm (19.68”* 19.68”) 
Question: do you sell any other size of Pacum bags? 
Answer: Pacum bags made for the suitcase. Pacum bag suit for 20” – 28” suitcase. We believe it is the best sizing space bag for travel. 
Question: How do I order extra bags? 
Answer: Please add that amount to your pledge and shipping will be included along with your Pacum. For example, if you want to buy 10 more bags, please add $2.5X10=$25 to your original pledge price.
Question: What should I do after pledge?
Answer: Before shipping, we will contact you for further information. For example: the address, the color you want, etc.
Question: Do I get warranty for my Pacum? 
Answer: Yes. We offer a one-year warranty for Pacum.
How to add amount to your pledge for additional Pacum bag?
1. Calculate the amount in HKD.
2. Add that amount in HKD
Example: 
Buying 2 Pacum Bags means you need to pledge additional HK$39.
Standard Pack + Shipping to US + 2 Pacum Bags
= HK$ 283 + 79 + (19.5 x 2) = HK$401
 This project is promoted by Green Inbox
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We understand and acknowledge that no project comes without risks and challenges. The greatest challenge is to bring this amazing product to the world. Some of our team members have over than 20-years industrial experience, we are confident to make Pacum be a magnificent product! We, therefore, need the help of the crowdfunding community to ship Pacum to all countries of the world. If we are met with these events, we promise to communicate with full transparency to you, our backers, and work to resolve all issues in a timely manner.

campaign.story:
The Magnet Driver™ Space Rocket commemorates the 50th anniversary of the Apollo 11 moon landing, emulating the Saturn V spaceship. Details of the Moon and the place and date of the first man landing on the moon are intertwined into the different pieces in the toolkit.
Extendable to four different heights (8 inch, 7 inch, 6 inch, 5 inch), with two extra-short direct positions, for a total of six different working distances, it works to reach very difficult places and allows you to drive even the tiniest screw with only one hand.
Magnet Driver™ Space Rocket is made from 6061 aluminum CR-V; it’s lightweight, yet extremely durable, and built to last…project after project.
Easily install, tighten and replace screws with the only magnetic, single-handed screwholder. The Magnet Driver™ Mini grips and holds screws in place, making fastening much easier in all aspects. You don’t even need a second hand involved.
There are five total Magnet Driver™ Minis — in two different colors signifying different sizes — that work with our 1-⅛” precision bits or standard 1-¾” precision bits.
The Magnet Driver™ Full Set reward comes with 20 extra-long S2 Steel bits in eight different types, and bits are color coded to match with the appropriate Magnet Driver™ Mini size.
This magnetic mat keeps your metal objects perfectly organized. Place small pieces and screws directly on the mat for guaranteed safety and security. Not to mention, it details the Moon and the place and date of the first man landing on the moon.
The Magnet Driver™ Carrying Case keeps everything safe and secure for easy portability.
                       Michael Perez, the inventor of Magnet Driver™ Space Rocket, has had a lifelong overarching passion for technology and has always been fond of the milestones it has reached over time. Coupled with his passion for technology, developing a precision screwdriver in honor of Apollo 11 was always a lifelong goal he strived to achieve. He spent a lot of time seeking a way to combine his passions into one product. From this, he developed the idea of the Magnet Driver™ Space Rocket, which perfectly merges a toolkit with space rocket and moon accents. The rest was history. For him, everything has to be related to this commemoration, as it is crucial to humanity. For this campaign, we’d like to give special thanks to our friend, Rafael Méndez Peña, who not only collaborated with NASA to produce documentaries and outreach videos, but also helped us with our video. He really knows how to rock it!
  We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us make Magnet Driver™ Space Rocket a reality.
We know not everyone will be able to support us with a pledge, so even if you can’t give a dollar or purchase a Magnet Driver™ Space Rocket, if you’re a supporter of Magnet Driver™ Space Rocket, you can help us spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Instagram and anywhere else you can think of!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always certain risks that can arise at any moment during a project like this. That being said, we’re confident in our ability to produce and have taken all the necessary measures. We already have partners that can help us to deliver a product in good conditions. Moreover this time we won´t be assembling it ourselves here in Spain, but the complete kit will be assembled in our factory. This will help us deliver the kit much faster and on time. We just need your help to bring everything to fruition. Don’t worry, we’re completely prepared to bring the Magnet Driver™ Space Rocket to you, and we have the manpower to make it happen, but if anything comes up along the way, you’ll be the first to know.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

We are thrilled to have you as one of our loyal customers, and we have some great news to share! MICATON is excited to announce that we will be using Kickstarter to crowdfund WHEEL DRIVER. Our campaign launched a few days ago — check it out by clicking HERE.
WHEEL DRIVER is a personal EDC to screw manually and carry out small repairs, or to use its storage system and bit holder with an electric screwdriver for larger projects, in any case, it allows screwing with just one hand avoiding the fall of the screws and it is composed of good materials so that you can perform a good work quality.
Dear backers,

campaign.story:
Braza Bro's Twin is here, the Braza Bro Cleaver!
Braza Bro is back with a different blade and a whole bunch of new materials, options and features. We listened to your feedback from the original Braza Bro Kickstarter and incorporated the improvements into this blade. Technically this is a Wharncliffe style blade, but it reminds us of a mini pocket cleaver.
Start your morning off right!
We didn’t set out to make the best mini pocket/keychain knife ever, it just happened. Mike at Bastion has been designing and making EDC blades and tools for a while, and he really knows what he’s doing. That’s why when I was dissatisfied with all other mini knives, he was the first person I turned to when looking to develop the perfect mini folding EDC knife... the Braza Bro. 
Mike on the right with the original Braza EDC knive, and Daniel on left with Braza Bro EDC mini knife launched on Kickstarter earlier this year. I swear that we are holding them the same distance from the camera, the size difference creates an optical illusion.
Braza Bro was a hit on Kickstarter earlier this year! Read more about the Braza Bro story here.
Now the duo have returned with an all new iteration of the Braza Bro. You may recognize the comfortable handle design, but that's where the similarities end. The blade is a completely new design, available in two different steels, stainless or titanium handle options, and other features that were highly requested by our backers.
Stylish & Versatile Wharncliffe Blade
Looking like the mad child of a bone busting clever and a hair popping razor blade, the  Wharncliffe style blade offers good looks with mad functionality. It's almost straight edge makes it good for carving and slicing. The pointed tip is like having a pocket exacto.
Ergonomic Handle Grip
The handle provides an excellent grip fitting in your first 3 fingers. The shape and contour of the handle will ensure that your hand won’t slip.
There’s a choil for the index finger, and a slight recess on the spine of the handle for the thumb to sit on. The blade spine is jimped to provide a non-slip grip for your finger. When in use, the Braza Bro feels much larger than it appears.
Not only is it extremely comfortable to hold and use, it’s also a beautiful knife to behold.
Comfortable to use.
NEW!!! Multiple Blade Metal Options
 S35VN Stainless Steel is the newest, coolest, most high tech, and toughest stainless steel alloy available. It's what everyone dreams of in an EDC pocket blade these days. It's harder than squirrel tits and keeps an edge better than a line of coke. No, but for real though, this is some tough shit. Made in the USA by Crucible, it starts off as a metal powder which allows better control over composition than the traditional mixing of molten metals. It's then sintered to bond the powders together into solid stainless steel.
 D2 Tool Steel is used in popular high-quality EDC tools. D2 is a high carbon and high chromium air hardening steel. Yes, that means it's harder than frozen t-rex shit, which then fossilized and froze again. The benefits that are offered from D2 steel are excellent wear and abrasion resistance which is provided from its large volumes of carbides in the microstructure. D2 is used in long production cold work applications requiring very high wear resistance and a high compression strength. D2 is harder than S35VN, but is susceptible to surface corrosion.
Which Steel Do I Want?
If you want a no maintenance blade that will never rust, then choose S35VN.
If you want the hardest and sharpest longester (yes, that's a new scrabble word, try it), then choose D2 steel. If you're afraid of a blade that may get a little bit of rust and forms a patina over time, then don't choose D2 steel. D2 is not for cry babies or those with weak hearts. It will cut you, and it will rust a little. The upside is that you'll never have to sharpen it. Ok, you will have to sharpen it if you cut rocks and fossilized shit with it, but you won't have to sharpen it as often as S35VN.
NEW!!! Titanium Handle Option
An ultralight titanium handle is paired with the S35VN blade. The weight difference is surprising when you hold it in your hand compared with the stainless handle.
NEW!!! Deep Carry Pocket Clip
Deep carry pocket clip was a highly requested feature change from the OG Braza Bro. Whether it makes you feel more discreet, or it gives you some good vibes that its more securely clipped onto your pocket, the deep carry clip looks bad ass, and is a feature rarely seen in knives this small.
NEW!!! Reversible Pocket Clip
Lefty's rejoice! The Braza Bro Cleaver now features a reversible pocket clip. The pocket clip can be put on the left or right handle scale, whatever you like best. There's even a tiny insert with torx screw that covers the hole on the unused side.
Use the deep carry on this side...
... or that side
 Cutting Edge Length: 2.12” (53.9mm)  
 Closed Length: 2.75” (70mm)  
 Open Length: 4.77" (121.3mm)  
 Total Weight: 1.34oz and 1.48 oz  
 Handle Material: Titanium or Stainless Steel  
 Cutting Steel: S35VN or D2 Tool Steel - heat treated for optimal edge hardness, strength and durability, stonewashed finish before grinding  
 Spine Jimping: Spine is jimped for non-slip finger hold  
 Bearing: Ceramic Ball Bearing - buttery smooth opening with no play.
 Hardware: Torx Stainless steel  
 Frame-lock: Adds security and strength  
 Pocket Clip: Stainless Steel and removable if not needed.
Keychain and Lanyard Hole
 Manual and Safe Operation: No spring, no assist, not automatic.  
Spine Jimping
Jimping refers to the series of notches on the spine of the blade near the handle. These notches provide increased grip for your finger to improve safety and cutting precision. 
Flipper 
The flipper allows for lightning quick, 1 handed deployment. A ball detent holds the blade securely closed, but a quick flick of your finger sends it flying out. Once open, the flipper acts as a finger guard.
The flipper is completely manual in operation. There is no spring and no assist, so the Braza Bro is not automatic. It follows the same manual opening and closing principals as a regular folding, locking knife. 
Ceramic Ball Bearings
Ceramic Ball Bearings make the opening action super smooth and have zero play so the blade won’t wobble when cutting. These bearings are more expensive than the commonly used phosphor bronze bushings, but they are totally worth it. You'll be blown away every time you experience how fast the Braza Bro blade flips out, and then feels as solid as a non-folding, fixed blade knife when cutting.  
Look at those tiny ball bearings!
Look Ma, No Play!
Ceramic Balls are suitable for applications where high loads, high speeds and extreme temperatures are factors. Long life and the need for minimal lubrication make this material appropriate for extreme applications. Ceramic is non-porous, non-magnetic, noncorrosive and lighter than steel. In ball form, ceramic balls are also harder than steel and because ceramic balls are non-porous they are virtually frictionless and capable of spinning faster than steel balls. 
Ultra-Strong Frame Lock
The frame lock is an integral part of this the Braza Bro EDC knife. The lock is CNC machined from the frame. It’s secure and easy to release using only one hand.
One-Handed Opening and Closing
The flipper and ceramic ball bearings allow for lightning fast, one-handed opening. The frame lock makes it easy to close one-handed also. The flipper serves double duty and protects your finger when closing.
Manual and Safe Operation
The opening and closing of the Braza Bro Cleaver are completely manual in operation. There is NO spring and NO assist, so it is NOT automatic. It is the same as a regular folding, locking pocket knife. It will only open with as much force as you can put on the flipper with your finger, so there's no danger of it swinging out unexpectedly. 
The cutting edge length is 2.12” (53.9mm), much smaller than normal blade length restrictions (the carry restrictions are usually about 2.5" max length).
A ball detent keeps it closed. Since there is NO spring, the cutting edge can't accidentally spring open in your pocket or on your keychain. 
It is up to you to check that local laws allow you to own or carry this tool.
Stainless Torx® Fasteners  
Torx® screws and fasteners are recognized by the six-point star design on the head. Created in 1967 these exceptionally secure high-quality fasteners can be found on a wide range of motorcycles, automobiles, and computer systems. Torx® products are known for their ability to prevent screw damage—and enable someone to produce a high amount of torque without causing harm to the product.
Ergonomic Contoured Grip  
Small knives can be hard to hold onto, but this is not the case with Braza Bro. The contoured handle provides an excellent grip and fits perfectly in your first 3 fingers when holding it. The flipper acts as a finger guard, preventing your hand from sliding forward onto the cutting edge.
Reversible Deep Carry Pocket Clip
The pocket clip is an essential feature that is often left out of mini pocket knives. Braza Bro allows you to choose between pocket clip, keychain, or lanyard carry. The pocket clip is made of stainless steel and coated the same color as the handle. The pocket clip is very secure. If the pocket clip is not needed, it is removable by using a Torx driver to remove the screw. 
Use the deep carry on this side...
... or that side
Keychain and Lanyard Hole  
The Braza Bro is the perfect EDC tool to keep on your keychain. The keychain and lanyard hole is more than a drilled hole afterthought as seen on other mini keychain knives. It is purposefully designed into the shape of the handle.
Open a can of whoopass!
Who cut the cheese? Again?
Pop a Cap!
Screw it!
Slice it!
What's inside the box?!?
Braza Bro Cleaver is the non-identical twin of the Braza Bro. It shares some of the same EDC genetics as the Braza Bro, but comes with a different blade style and many improvements.
The process of creating the Braza Bro was more than just shrinking the original Braza. We had to go back to CAD and layout the new smaller design. Everything was miniaturized, from the tiny ceramic ball bearings that make it open so smooth and keep it wiggle free, to the smaller pins, screws and pocket clip. 
We took all the backer input from the first Braza Bro and added a new blade style to create the Braza Bro Cleaver
You will be able to select the blacked out option when you fill out the shipping survey through BackerKit after the Kickstarter ends.
Share the Braza Bro Cleaver and Earn Cash!
We're looking for assistance to spread the word about this campaign! We have a referral program that you can earn cash for any successful referrals through your unique referral link.
 All you have to do is: 
Head to our Booster page below and sign up to boost our campaign   
Copy your unique referral link  
Share the link on your Facebook, Twitter, Blog, Website, or wherever you'd like! 
Refer to your dashboard to monitor your referrals and commissions!
We will ship almost anywhere in the world (with the exception of a few countries that have embargos due to some unfortunate messed up political climate).
United Kingdom - We can not ship to anyone under 18. To purchase a Braza Bro from the UK, please email info@bastiongear.com and provide the following information:  
Photo of government-issued ID that proves you are 18 or older.
Shipping will be $15, the same as any other international country.
Brazil - Due to high rate of package theft, we are sorry that we can no longer ship to Brazil. If you live in Brazil and would like a Braza Bro Cleaver, we recommend that you find someone in the US who can relay the package to you. We will refund any order that ships to Brazil.
All other countries - It is your responsibility for checking your local laws to determine whether you can import or own this pocket tool. We can not be held responsible if the package is confiscated by customs.
Press Pack, High Res images, and additional information is all here on our website.
Google Drive link to directly download Images and Gifs.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
BASTION LLC is well established in the EDC (Every Day Carry) community, and has a large number of loyal customers. They sell directly online at their web-store and through many retailers nationwide. All funds from this project are collected directly by BASTION LLC and used for production costs and all other costs related to the campaign. Bastion LLC is responsible for the production and delivery of the campaign rewards. Daniel Bauen and Engineerable LLC are only participating as a consultant in the design and marketing and hosting aspects of the campaign and cannot be held financially responsible.

Delays in production and distribution from our manufacturing source are the most likely issues that we could encounter, but we have a lot of experience in resolving any problems and bringing our products to life.

Bastion LLC has a dedicated fulfillment warehouse on the east coast that provides quick and efficient packaging and shipping to our customers. They use the United States Postal Service (USPS) as their primary delivery source. We cannot control for mail delivery schedules managed by USPS, which could be impacted by weather, transportation, or local facility issues.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Second Batch Of Orders Are Shipping Out!!!!!
updates.update_content:
The second batch of Cleavers have arrived and are being shipped out today and next week.
I can't find my BackerKit survey email?
If you haven't yet filled out your Backerkit survey, or can't find the link, go here and enter the email address that you used for Kickstarter: https://braza-bro-cleaver.backerkit.com/

The first batch of 500 pcs started shipping last week. More are coming next week and shipping will continue.
Blacked Out Cleavers and Cleaver+
These are completed and coming in next week and will start to ship after they are received and organized.
I can't find my BackerKit survey email?

The Backerkit surveys are being sent out. I just started the process, and the first step is to send out a smoke test to 5% of backers to make sure that everything is working well. If everything looks good, I'll send out the rest by tomorrow. This survey shows you the colors and locks down the color choices. 
Many of you have asked about adding additional Cleavers or Cleaver+ to your order. After you select the colors for your kickstarter pledge, you can add on extra Cleavers.

updates.update_userinfo: 1st Batch of Braza Bro Cleavers has arrived
updates.update_content: A first batch of Braza Bro Cleaver, and Braza Bro Cleaver+ knives have arrived at our warehouse. These are only the silver/titanium colored knives. 500 pcs of D2/Stainless Cleavers and 500 pcs of S35VN/Titanium Cleaver+. This is enough to start shipping orders, but not enough to fulfill all the orders until we receive the next batch in 20-30 days. The Blacked Out blades are still in production and are also about 20-30 days out from delivery. If you selected Blacked Out, you may now be tempted to change to Silver (which you can when the shipping survey is sent out) to have it shipped earlier. Even though some of the silver/titanium knives will be able to ship sooner than the Blacked Out versions, if your order is shipped in the second batch the wait time will be the same. Therefore I don’t recommend changing to Silver/Titanium solely because it might ship sooner, because there is a 50/50 chance that it won’t. If you want to change for aesthetic reasons, then that is fine.

Thank you all for your patience while this Cleaver was being manufactured and prepared for shipping. Surveys will be rolling out to you shortly. Once you have filled out the surveys we will begin shipping your order right away! Again, thank you for your patience. We look forward to getting these Cleavers out to you!

Thank you to everyone for submitting the Silver vs Blacked out surveys.
There were some questions about there being 3 color options, Silver, Titanium, or Blacked Out. To clarify: 
Bro Cleaver (D2 Blade / Stainless Steel Handle) - Silver is the standard color for the stainless handle cleaver. Titanium is not an option for stainless handle cleaver.

Hi!
We did the thing, everybody! We made it with GREAT SUCCESS!

campaign.story:
Because you are reading this, you are likely one of few in the world who understands the joy and connection that happens when pen meets paper. You know that the connection goes beyond what is physical, and extends to your inner thoughts, fears, dreams, and beyond. We are on the same page, which is why Ferris Wheel Press has one simple mission: to help everyone Fall in Love with Writing Again. We are so glad you've chosen to be a part of our mission! 
Following the successful introduction of our Brush Fountain Pen, we are now launching a collection of premium fountain pen inks that are the perfect desktop companion to any aspiring stationery lover. 
Ink deserves to be inspiring, from the moment you receive it, to when you draw it into your pen, it should remind you of the magic of writing.
So we created an inspiring set of fountain pen inks, carefully crafted in 3 distinct colours that will spur excitement, creativity, and a feeling of absolute joy every time you write!
Fall in Love with Writing Again with our suite of stationery products that are uniquely designed to speak to the hand, heart and mind.
Bluegrass Velvet and Tanzanite Sky
Collapsible and Re-usable Gift Box
The journey from prototype to production
Want to do EVEN MORE to support the hand-written lifestyle? Pick up a set of our stationery inspired enamel pins so you can literally wear your heart on your sleeve! 
Review and colour swab by @skybambi
        @Saricastudio scribes in Tanzanite Sky
                        @ThePaperVoyager
       PLAY

Get Cash Back on the Projects You Love!
To select your preferred ink and/or pen colours, you need to first select your backer reward level and complete your payment/contact details. 
When our Kickstarter campaign becomes fully funded (hooray!), we will be reaching out to each one of you at the end of the campaign for your preferred choices through a user-friendly survey. 
Our campaign needs to be fully backed/funded to move forward into production, so be sure to support us and share the news with your stationery loving friends to help us reach our funding goal! Write on!
Disclaimer: All images of ink bottles have been brightened for illustrative purposes only. The finished ink is darker in person.
Get Your Project Funded Today!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our mission is to help the world fall in love with writing again, and as a stationery company that has been in business for 9 years we are confident in our ability to deliver this product. Design, testing, and R&D all happens in our Toronto based studio where a team of 20 designers and craftsmen are working tirelessly to bring this project to life. 

As we have created many products in the past, the only challenge we foresee is that of logistics and fulfilment in the event that our campaign is massively oversold. However, we have already prepared our partners for this scenario because we are that confident that you will love our product!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Read this page in: Deutsch | Русский
120% FUNDED - Thank you!
Stretch goal #1: Fallen Fortress stretch goal unlocked!
Fascinating combat encounter where the player must defend a crashed bomber in the desert against a crowd of raiders.
Stretch goal #2: Free Play mode unlocked!
Encased won’t end when the credits roll. Moreover, the post-completion Free Play Mode will get a number of interesting options, additional quests, events and dialogues.
Stretch goal #3: Upgradable Mobile HQ is unlocked!
An auto-train buried in the sands will appear on the outskirts of the Dome. The hero will be able to capture and restore it, and use it as a mobile base of operations.
$130 000 — Player Vehicles. The desert under the Dome is vast and dangerous. It is much safer, and less exhausting, to travel behind the wheel of your own vehicle.
$130 001 — 1 Combond Encounter. We’re all used to quests of epic complexity being rewarded with superior loot and good money. But what about an adventure that pays a single coin?
$135 000 — Personal Drone Assistants. Robotics is one area where the technologies under the Dome have been successfully implemented.
$145 000 — Gladiator Arena. Having been captured by one of the raider factions, a player may find himself in a real post-apocalyptic coliseum!  
$160 000 — Mod Support. We will create a toolkit with a user-friendly interface to pass along to our players.
$210 000 — Narrative Voiceover. Encased has a lot of stories that could be even better if the “narrator” had a real voice. But we need your help with this.
Learn more about stretch goals in KS Update #21.
Watch latest KS-trailer!
You can include add-ons to help reach stretch goals! Read about add-ons in KS Update #23

You need to pledge CRONUS Corporal tier or above to be able to include add-ons.
- Extra digital copy of Encased - $22 / €18.5
- Alpha Access + Beta - $20 / €17
- Beta Access - $10 / €8.5
- Printed Lorebook - $30 / €25.5 (Shipping costs $4 USA, $6 Rest of the World)
- CRONUS t-shirt $20 / €17 (Shipping costs $4 USA, $6 Rest of the World)
- CRONUS Hoodie $45 / €38 (Shipping costs $4 USA, $6 Rest of the World)
- CRONUS Rogue Baseball Cap $25 / €21 (Shipping costs $4 USA, $6 Rest of the World)
- CRONUS Employee Badge $50 / €42.5 (Shipping costs $4 USA, $6 Rest of the World)
Short Description
The game is set in an alternate 1970's and revolves around the exploration of the Dome, a mysterious structure discovered in a remote desert. No one knows the exact nature of those who built the Dome, but the founders of this advanced civilization have come to be called the Forefathers.
Click to download ultra hi-res
You will discover miraculous technologies and weird artifacts in the labyrinths of the Dome, but that is not all the Forefathers left behind. Watch out for automated security systems, traps, and inexplicable anomalies.
In addition, the Dome itself is showing signs of consciousness. It has been reacting to the human presence since the first explorers entered its domain. Once inside, no one is able to leave. Uncovering the wonders and dangers of the Dome is a one-way road.
Exploration and exploitation of the Dome is carried out by the CRONUS Foundation, a massive organization founded by the world’s most powerful governments.
Narrative
Learn more about the narrative of Encased - in KS-update #14
What the press says
Why Kickstarter?
We want Encased to be just the way you see the perfect CRPG: a huge game, rich in content, sort of “the Fallout of our dreams”, which all of us could be proud of. 
We are developing the game for a while already. We have reached pre-alpha and we are confident that Encased could become a great game. But we are a small team, and there is a lot of things that we’d like to add. With your help, Encased could become a way more ambitious, better fleshed out and polished project!
But it’s not just about the money that could help us expand the game! One of our ground rules is to create games arm-in-arm with our community.
A little bit about where the money will go
Kickstarter and taxes will take away about 10% of the funds. Part of what’s left will be spent on actual implementation and shipping of all the wonderful rewards we’ve come up with. All the rest we will spend on polishing, expanding, and improving the game. That includes a possibly bigger team - one more artist and several designers and scripters - which will spruce up the graphics and increase the number and quality of fights and story interactions. Also, the money will go towards voicework and localization which will make the game more fun and accessible for everyone.
Social Goals
Learn more about social goals in KS-Update #11!
Facebook likes: Like the Encased Facebook page and encourage your friends to do the same!
Facebook shares: share the Encased announcement post on Facebook.
Twitter followers: follow @darkcrystal_hq on Twitter and encourage your friends to too.
Twitter retweets: retweet the announcement tweet from @darkcrystal_hq
Twitter likes: Like the announcement tweet from @darkcrystal_hq
Discord fans: join our Discord group.
The Story
As a new recruit, the player must choose one of five Wings:
Black Wing - military and security forces;
White Wing - scientists, medics and researchers;
Blue Wing - engineers and technicians;
Silver Wing - upper management;
Orange Wing - ex-convicts who have exchanged their prison jumpsuits for the uniform of a CRONUS laborer.
Though your selected Wing grants certain starting bonuses and opens interesting options, your choice does not lock you into a “class”. You are free to develop your character, distribute skill points, and choose abilities as you wish.
Upon completing character creation, you are summoned to Crystal Sands, a city built directly outside the Dome as a staging point for personnel and equipment.
The transition station mounted at the apex of the Dome, above the only aperture, is called the Spire. After basic training, you will descend from the Spire into the Dome to land at Magellan HQ. 
There is much to uncover during your first mission underground…. Relying on your stats and Wing training, you will find there are several ways to resolve each challenge. Replayability is one of our main goals for the game. After your briefing at HQ comes your first task: exploring a newly discovered Forefathers compound tagged Object O-12-Nashville.
After a few adventures inside the Nashville object (which we don’t want to spoil just yet), your group encounters an entirely new anomaly. You awaken something dreaming deep beneath the desert of the Dome. Your trespass has activated Maelstrom, a telepathic entity created to serve the Forefathers. 
All connection with the world outside the Dome is lost and Maelstrom rages across the desert, infecting the minds of everyone it encounters. You and your group fall into a technology-induced stasis for five long years. And when you come to, the entire world has changed. 
Encased combat is inspired by classic, tactical turn-based systems, with a grid overlay, action points, cover system, special abilities, various ammo and damage types, many different resistances, and more!
The player has direct control over his character only. You will manage the behavior and tactics of their your henchmen but their specific actions will be guided by the game’s combat AI system, introducing funny and interesting situations into your battles.
There are dozens of weapons to be found, many of which can be stripped and upgraded. 
The world of the Dome has from its discovery been a place full of weird creatures and dangerous traps. There’s no telling what lies around the next bend in the road, or inside the twilit cave, or beneath the murky waters of the swamp. But who knows? Perhaps humans are the biggest threat in this bizarre land.
Maelstrom dominates everything. It's telepathic rage sowing chaos in the minds of everyone, trapped under the Dome. But the player, having "freed" the entity, enjoys a special relationship with it. The two of you have regular interactions and Maelstrom may even grant "whishes" to the player... but be warned: every call for assistance will eventually incur a price. 
Maelstrom's power grows stronger the closer you move to the heart of the Dome, and that's exactly where you must go to find the answers. There is a special stat influencing interactions with Maelstrom: Psyche. Resistance to Maelstrom's negative effect can be developed in several ways, and develop it you must before you may venture deeper into the Dome. There is also a special skill branch related to Psychic abilities.
We will talk about Maelstrom and gameplay related to it in the future updates.
Following the devastating events of Maelstrom’s release, CRONUS splintered into multiple other, often warring, factions. The world has changed while you were in stasis, but has the nature of Man? Trapped inside the Dome like spiders in a jar, these factions will show the worst and best of humankind. Will you join them, or strike out on your own?
Learn more about factions in our Kickstarter Update #2
If the player chooses to commit crimes against the society, he will incur penalties to his reputation and earn titles ranging from 'Petty Thief' to 'Enemy of the State' or even 'Threat to Humanity'. Crime begets punishment. The player may be fined, imprisoned, and even executed. Luckily, there are several ways to deal with your arrest: bribe judges, organize a jailbreak or return alive from the Labyrinth of Death (this last one may be particularly challenging).
Encased features a day and night cycle with accompanying lighting effects. It would be wise to study NPC routines while adventuring.
The Dome is huge and for the most part is an open sandbox (if you are able to resist the psychic presence of Maelstrom). The map consists of more than 170 sectors, each crafted by hand. There are abandoned bunkers, black caves, the complexes of the Forefathers, as well as wastes, swamps and other biomes.
Random encounters have been a standby of the old-school role playing game since the dawn of the genre. But Encased will bring them to a new level. Each encounter is a separate post-apocalyptic story, not just a bunch of critters attacking you. Want to participate in a game of Russian Roulette? Find a pathway through a deadly anomaly to find a rare relic? Defend an automated rail transport from raiders? Or end up a victim yourself. All this awaits you, in addition to more classic encounters.
Read more about Random Encounters in our Update #5
Guest Stars and Experts!
  Platforms and dates
Encased is being developed for PC, Mac, Linux, PS4, Xbox One and Nintendo Switch. Early Access for the Windows version will likely begin in the first quarter of 2019, exclusively on Steam. The final version will launch during 2019 on Steam, GOG and other services. The console edition is planned for the winter of 2020.
Digital Rewards explained
CRONUS employee ID badge

An employee using your name set out on an expedition in the desert… and vanished. Nothing was found but their badges. The mystery must be solved before it happens again. Will you accept the quest?

Map

A detailed map of the known world under the Dome, showing all the cities and settlements of the Foundation, along with the entries to the ‘objects’, explored and unexplored. Restricted to higher ranks amongst certain Wings, the map also indicates some locations that the Foundation would prefer to keep secret. A gift for those with the time and inclination to explore 30,000 square kilometers of desert.

Lorebook

A digital version of the lorebook, containing all that is known and worth knowing about the Dome and the world within. The story of its discovery, an atlas of its most interesting sites, and an insight into the CRONUS Foundation — including never-before-told stories of some of its more secret projects — this is the only book a dedicated digital Domehead will ever need.

Soundtrack

The hum of a machine of unknown origin, deep beneath the shifting, singing sands. Undeciphered signals from the Tower, snatches of CB radio and a quiet guitar arpeggio in a sleepy roadside bar. In the hands and mind of the Mushroomer — composer for Pathologic 2 — the desert becomes music.

A short story about the Dome

Charlene Putney, writer on the renowned Divinity: Original Sin 2, spins a tale of the events that followed the discovery of the Dome.

Portraits

An extended set of hand-drawn in-game avatars, exclusive to campaign backers.

Closed alpha and beta access

Help test the alpha or beta versions of the game testing. Check out Encased gameplay months before anyone else.

Your nickname in random encounters

Raider gangs inhabit the desert beneath the Dome. In random encounters, the game picks a random name from a database. Your nickname — on our approval — will be one of them.

Baseball card
  Pretty much everyone supports the Crystal Sands Rogues baseball franchise - at least until they lose - and the players’ baseball cards are collected and traded across the Foundation. Recruited from Orange Wing employees with talent and application, under-performing gets you cut from the roster - and getting cut sees you sent into the Dome.

Life Pass

Free lifetime access to all projects released by Dark Crystal Games.

Design a non-generic NPC

Work with the devs to build a character - come up with their name, appearance, and role in the story.

Player portrait

Your face here. We will add a character avatar drawn from your photo to the game, and also give you a digital copy of the image.


An episode of the story-based mini-game, dedicated to you

Games are popular under the Dome too. Some of the miraculously preserved terminals house a popular text game, the hero of which bears your name. Coincidence?

Developers stream

We’ll join you on a livestream of the game, for your audience or ours.

A cool in-game item, exclusive to and chosen by the backers
A rare gun? Custom armor? An unusual combat stim? You, the backers, will decide. But remember, it won’t break the game’s balance. We’re not that generous.

Physical Rewards explained
Blue Wing Engineer t-shirt
In vivid antifreeze blue, this fine t-shirt is the favorite of CRONUS technical staff, from the lowliest technician to the chief engineer. While not standard issue, most Blue Wing employees have one. And now so will you.
Rogues baseball cap
The Crystal Sands Rogues baseball franchise is largely recruited from Orange Wing employees with talent, aggression, and a desire to avoid entering the Dome. Last year’s was a winning season, and none of the players lost their places. But luck shifts like the sands, and this year may be different. And you, the fans, can be less than forgiving.
 Explorer hoodie
The desert is cold at night, so each CRONUS employee who must venture outside is issued with a sweatshirt. Soft and comfortable, it offers excellent protection against the cold, so at least you won’t freeze to death while you die of radiation poisoning.
CRONUS Badge
Printed Lorebook
This 70-page glossy volume contains all that is known and worth knowing about the Dome and the world within. The story of its discovery, an atlas of its most interesting sites, and an insight into the CRONUS Foundation — including never-before-told stories of some of its more secret projects — this is the only book a dedicated Domehead will ever need.
Raider mask
The mask of an insane desert raider, hand-painted by our artists.

Leads
Viacheslav Kozikhin - Project Lead, Alexander Tuzhik - Lead Programmer, Andrey Lyapichev - Art Director, Mark Rhainer - Lead Writer, Konstantin Ivanov - Lead Technical Designer.  
Team members
Igor Frolov - Programmer, Nikita Dudnik - Programmer, Alina Karimova - Junior Game Designer, Alexander Arsenyev - Character Artist, Grigory Radin - Environmental Artist, Alexander Davtyan - Concept Artist, Stepan Filippov - Animator, Arkady Filippov - VFX-artist, Vadim Feoktistov - Game Writer, Alexander Lepyokhin - Game Writer, Maksim Nizhelevlev - Sound Designer, Vlad Lipkin - Community Manager, Vadim Rybkin - PR/UA Manager, Dmitriy Yaschenko - QA  
Games we’ve worked on
Divinity: Original Sin 2, Divinity: Original Sin Enhanced Edition, World of Warships, Dragon Age 2, Dragon Age 3, Star Wars: The Old Republic, Leviathan: The Last Day of the Decade, Skyforge, Blitzkrieg 3, Alekhine’s gun: Ghost of Moscow, Life is Feudal, Life is Feudal: Forest Village - and many other projects... 
Useful Links
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
What are the risks and challenges? 

We are developing this game for a while already. However, despite our experience and best efforts, there’s always a chance that something will go wrong. 

1. Early access and release dates. All of the people on our team have already delivered commercially successful games on time and in great condition. However, no true professional will ever tell you, that he is fail-proof. There is always a chance Encased RPG will require to postpone it's set final release date. At least to get an extra coat of polish.

2. We might have delays in delivering our reward promises. The reward delivery channels are extremely reliable, but, there's always a possibility that the reward delivery could be delayed due to technical issues.

3. We are used to dealing with budgets large and small. Financially speaking, Encased RPG budget has been calculated precisely. We are also financing most of the game ourselves, calling community only to finance additional features. However, a drastic change in rates of currency, financial depression, and other unforeseen economic consequences may rob our game of some of the promised content. The odds of that are amazingly low, but it's only fair to mention that as a risk.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: Hello everyone, Dark Crystal Games is here again! It's time to tell you about the fifth major content update for Encased: A Sci-Fi Post-Apocalyptic RPG. You will discover an expanded world after a mysterious Incident destroyed our way of life, and reduced the all-powerful CRONUS Foundation to rubble. Get ready for new adventures, locations, quests and enemies!

campaign.story:
People often suffer from long term mouse use. Traditional mouses with a fix angle will most likely injure or strain your hands after longterm use. Navee is Delux’s latest ergonomic mouse aimed to relieve wrist pains, especially for people diagnosed with CTS and RSI.  
        "I really love it and I love it even more as I used it more and more!" -- Nemanja Sekulic, Tech YouTuber 
"It does fit nicely in the hands, very smooth to control!" -- Chigz Tech Reviews, Tech YouTuber
"This is something I do recommend to people who have carpal tunnel syndrome." -- Zi Reviews Tech, Tech YouTuber
The Navee mouse is fully customizable with up to 20 degrees to best fit your palm. People have different hand shapes and Nevee lets you find what feels most natural to you.  
Navee’s dial is easily accessible by your fingers and thumb compared to traditional scroll. Instead of just your index finger, the control is now shared with the rest of your hand.
With its vertical and ergonomic design, Navee keeps your hand in a natural position while working, preventing you force your wrist causing future injuries.
It’s yours, make it your own. When using a Windows interface with the drive, users can customize up to 6 shortcuts right on the mouse. As for Macs, switch between all your pages by just using the mouse. You can make it use like your own customizable mouse to improve working efficiency.
The Navee mouse comes with three connection options as well as the option to connect it up to three devices. All connection options are wireless, the Navee offers connectivity through a 2.4G USB, Bluetooth 3.0, and Bluetooth 4.0. Pair the mouse with up to three devices with one of these three connection options.
There is a magnetic latch at the bottom for the dongle, it is sturdy and secured.
Not only is it ergonomical, it can shine bright in the dark too. With 16.8 million RGB floating lights and color backlighting, it’s guaranteed to stand out in the day and night.
Designed especially with a rechargeable Li-ion battery, the Navee mouse can last more than a month with a single charge. Full charge the battery for 2.5 hours to get up to 40 days of usage time.
We have equipped it with up to 4000 DPI and 4 adjustable levels: 600-1200-1600-4000. The Navee mouse is highly sensitive and reactive to even the smallest of movements.
Don’t have a mouse pad? No worries, the Navee mouse is fully functional on various surfaces from cloth to granite to even paper. Thanks to its laser LED sensors, it can work on any surface.
It doesn’t matter if you have a Mac, Windows, Android, or Linux, the Navee mouse is fully functional with all. Whether you’re a Mac user or Windows user, the Navee mouse comes with customized shortcuts for each.
Crafted with a layer of fine matte plastic and textured rubberized ABS. Navee’s anti-skid design empowers the users to maneuver through their screens accurately and swiftly.  
As a specialist of ergonomic vertical mouse and keyboard, Delux has developed a sound number of vertical mouse where Navee is crafted in the sense of cumulative experiences.
Go to Delux website to find out more great design product.
The first campaign of Delux Designer - The Perfect Assistant for Designers, funded more than $120,000 on Kickstarter.
Funded in 1994, Delux has more than 24 years of experience in Esports equipment and the R&D, manufacturing, sales, and services experience for A.I. products. Delux has been a long-term Intel strategic partner and have exported products to more than 120 countries worldwide.
Delux’s previously launch Designer keyboard was widely successful in raising more than $132k USD thanks to the supported of over 2,000 people. As an ergonomic tech specialist, Deux has developed a number of vertical mouses. Taking note of previous popular features, our designers created the Navee by combining all these features into a single mouse.
Navee is designed for the best long term comfort. Our team is composed of typists, gamers, and ergonomic experts who have spent years in each perspective fields. After numerous attempts and optimizations, the 6th edition of Delux’s ergo mouse is born.
Navee comes in 2 design patterns to tackle the root of the problems instead of offering you a temporary solution. After several months of prototyping and testing various designs, we finally created Navee as a simple, practical, and portable ergo mouse.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We've spent a lot of time designing a product that meets the highest standards of performance, durability, and convenience. We’ve finalized our production schedule and plans with our own experienced factory to ensure that the Delux Navee can be shipped out as planned. Before launching our project on Kickstarter, we’ve already worked on prototypes that are currently undergoing extensive testing and trial benchmarks to push the devices to their limits to expose any flaws. Our experiences in product development gives us insight into all aspects of the production process, including manufacturing in large volumes and the logistics need to cater to different countries around the world. With our experienced factory, we are confident to handle any foreseeable risks and deliver a low-risk, high-quality product to our backers on time. If anything goes out of control, we’ll be sure to always be transparent and let our backers know what’s going on.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
A quick update on where we currently are.
In an attempt to accelerate the shipping process, we’ve opened the backer survey a few days earlier. We are collecting and organizing all the info from the survey now, please fill it as soon as you can.

Hi backers,
Long time no see, it has been a while since we moved to Indiegogo.
We are getting ready for the mass production, we need you confirm the personal information including the shipping address and color option, please refer to the backer survey sent to your mailbox via kickstarter.

Dear Backers, 
Never in our wildest dream have we imagined raising over US$103,000 in the campaign! 
Good news is we have started the production so everything is going smoothly according to the plan and we will ship out your orders in November! 
We will also send out a survey in a few days to collect important info including addresses and color preferences to make sure we send you the correct order!

campaign.story:
The world’s first tripod for smartphone, GoPro, Mirrorless and DSLR cameras, designed for speed and ultra-portability. Never leave your tripod behind again.
A quick and simple setup will empower you to take full advantage of every photo opportunity....4 seconds and you’re ready to go.
We got tired of carrying around heavy, bulky tripods that we never ended up using. Lumapod is specifically designed to be brought on all your adventures.
 Instantly capture and share your experiences in the moment.
Of course a fast setup and ultra-compact design are great, but what good is a tripod if it isn’t stable? We carefully selected premium materials like high-grade aluminum and kevlar ropes to ensure reliable stability.
Use it with your Smartphone, GoPro, Mirrorless, DSLR Camera and more...
Easily use it to snap a selfie and then quickly set it down to capture a self-portrait. Either way you can always be in the shot.
When you’re not in the photo, use it as a monopod to shoot lively Hyperlapses
There is more that separates Go85 and Go120 than just their heights (85cm & 120cm). We carefully optimized both models for specific demands.
Lumapod Go85 
We relentlessly designed Go85 to be as compact and lightweight as humanly possible without compromising on quality or performance. The result is a perfect travel buddy for your smartphone, GoPro and cameras that weigh up to 1kg / 2.2lbs.
Unlike Go120, it does not have interchangeable legs. However, it is equipped with integrated terrain levelers to accommodate for those situations with uneven ground.
 Lumapod Go120
Go120 has all the benefits of Go85 but with an overall larger height and build that will support cameras that weigh up to 2kg /4.4lbs.
In addition, Go120 has modular leg extensions which creates a wide-range of possibilities for adaptability. It currently comes standard with terrain leveling extensions.
Easily turn your Go120 into a slider with the add-on dolly wheel extensions.
Or utilize the stake extensions for soft grounds, sand and snow.
                                             Breakdown - Choose Lumapod if you’re looking for better speed, compactness, weight and the adaptability of different leg extensions. Choose a standard tripod if you need extra stability and additional terrain flexibility.
Lumapod is compact with more height, better stability and offers the benefit of having both tripod and selfie mode.
Lumapod offers the same selfie capability but with all the benefits of a stable tripod as well.
Have you ever wondered why all tripods look the same? Is there really only one design that works? We challenged this theory and worked tirelessly to design Lumapod different.
There is a simple mechanical principle behind our design: replace compression parts (traditional legs) with tensioning components (Kevlar Ropes). Perhaps it’s easier to understand when compared to something everyone knows:
Much like how the mast on a sailboat withstands wind with its tensioned ropes, we use the same theory to achieve stability. It’s no rocket science but the key to our design is being able to lock and tension Lumapod in any position.
Lumapod’s stability isn’t just by luck. We did extensive research and testing to measure the vibrations and damping of many tripods. Our electro-mechanical test setup enabled us to optimize Lumapod and ensure it is as stable as possible.
                                             Showing the bigger steps of lumapods development
Hey! We are Lumapod. We are a small start-up located in Austria who love to travel and take photos.
Because we love what we do, the campaign video was made 100% by the team and only with team members and friends. So if you watched it, you may have already seen us.
                                                             Thank you to our existing partners
                This project is promoted by Jellop , the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 500+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $235MM raised between them.
This project is promoted by Green Inbox Partner Program which includes risk free Facebook ads
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have made it our priority from the very beginning to develop the best tripod possible and mitigate any risks we can. With that said; The Lumapod prototypes used in the campaign might be subject to minor adjustments if improvement with either stability, versatility, design or overall use of the product can be found helpful. 
 
The timeline for production and final delivery have been very carefully calculated based on realistic data and estimations. If, for some reason something changes or alters this timeline, we promise to make it our highest priority to communicate these updates to our backers. In fact, we will monitor and provide updates on all important activities throughout the entire process. Thank you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Lotus and the Artichoke - ETHIOPIA
Hi, it's Justin! I'm back on Kickstarter now for my 6th international cookbook project. In 2012, I launched my first project with Kickstarter: The Lotus and the Artichoke - Vegan Recipes from World Adventures, followed by the German edition (Vegane Rezepte eines Weltreisenden) in 2013. The series continued with English and German publications of: The Lotus and the Artichoke - MÉXICO (2014), SRI LANKA (2015), MALAYSIA (2016), and INDIA (2017).
This year I traveled to Ethiopia in the weeks before Easter – one of several special times of fasting, when the majority of the country eats entirely vegan! I explored the central cities, traveled overland to the north, went trekking in the highlands and stayed with families in remote villages. 
As with all my travels and culinary research, I am extremely grateful for the privilege to learn, share & exchange, and be guided & supported by many families and professional cooks who invited me in their kitchens and shared amazing meals with me.
Since returning to Berlin, I've been cooking Ethiopian and Eritrean food practically non-stop, recreating recipes and dishes, constantly inviting friends and guests to my cooking studio for lunch and dinner parties.
Abebech showing me traditional village cooking in the Ethiopian Highlands.
Making injera with the family in Gonder, Ethiopia
The Lotus and the Artichoke - ETHIOPIA is my newest cookbook with original recipes, artwork, photography and stories inspired by these latest culinary adventures. It includes over 70 recipes based on the mouth-watering meals in bustling cities & towns, at road-stop eateries, and in rural highland villages.
As with my previous 5 cookbooks, I have written, illustrated, cooked, photographed, and designed this book myself. The Lotus and the Artichoke is the ultimate combination of my passions: art, travel, vegan cooking, and photography.
The ETHIOPIA Cookbook at a glance:
My 6th cookbook of vegan recipes inspired by my travels, stays with families, and cooking in the kitchens of restaurants worldwide
140 pages with 70+ recipes and over 60 full-page color photos
Personal stories, art, and recipes inspired by my travels and culinary adventures in East Africa
Also based on experiences with international communities of Europe (London, Paris, and Berlin) and North America (Philadelphia, New York, and Washington D.C.) and over 25 years of vegan cooking  
Ethiopian & Eritrean classics, familiar restaurant & family favourites, delicious delights, wonders & surprises, and creative culinary experiments
Discover new flavors, tasty spices, and cooking skills
Great for cooks of all levels, from beginner to advanced: Recipes use easy-to-find ingredients (Cook everything, anywhere!)
Delicious, easy-to-follow recipes designed to satisfy and impress eaters of all ages, tastes, and minds
Available in ENGLISH… und auch auf DEUTSCH!

You, Me, & Kickstarter
Why Kickstarter? Because I love it! Crowdfunding is an awesome adventure. I enjoy the interaction with supporters, other cooks, bloggers, travelers, Kickstarter backers, and people from all over the world that love to dream, and help others with their own dreams.
In 2013, a small, indie publisher in Germany contacted me about being a publishing partner. I soon started working with Ventil Verlag and The Lotus and the Artichoke joined the emerging Edition Kochen ohne Knochen series of vegan & vegetarian cookbooks. It's an incredible partnership, and I enjoy working with an alternative publisher that understands the struggles and challenges for independent authors.
Being with a small publisher, my production costs and expenses for writing, cooking, photographing, illustrating, and designing my own cookbooks are not really covered.
I am passionate about my projects, and know they have a value for many people. I'm here on Kickstarter to ask for your support and involvement, to help continue and evolve The Lotus and the Artichoke project.
Kickstarter LIVE cooking show. 2016.
THE STORY of The Lotus and the Artichoke
In 2012, my first Kickstarter project The Lotus and the Artichoke - Vegan Cookbook was successful with the help of over 360 amazing backers from around the world. It was my first cookbook in a developing series of books featuring my personal stories, photographs, artwork, and vegan recipes inspired by my travels and culinary experiences in 40 countries.
In December, the first edition of The Lotus and the Artichoke - Vegan Recipes from World Adventures was printed: 1000 copies in full color, featuring over 100 recipes and more than 90 full-page, mouth-watering photographs. The Lotus and the Artichoke quickly became an international sensation.
After another successful Kickstarter project in 2013, The Lotus and the Artichoke – Vegane Rezepte eines Weltreisenden was translated and published in German – along with the second English edition.
Later that year, I traveled to Mexico with my partner Julia and our young son Kolja, where we lived in a small town for 3 months, cooking (and surfing) with the locals. I documented our experiences and cooking adventures in my next book, The Lotus and the Artichoke - MÉXICO which was published in English & German in 2014.
The following winter we spent 10 weeks exploring Sri Lanka. The Lotus and the Artichoke - SRI LANKA was published in 2015, following a sucessful third Kickstarter project with over 737 backers from more than 30 countries worldwide.
I traveled around Malaysia, Singapore & Borneo for 5 weeks in early 2016 learning to cook traditional Malay, Chinese, and Indian dishes from the locals. The Lotus and the Artichoke - MALAYSIA was published that year, after another successful Kickstarter with support from all over the world.
In Autumn 2016 and Spring 2017 I went for my 7th and 8th trip to India to for six weeks of research and cooking on location in Kashmir, Ladakh, and the Northeast States. The Lotus and the Artichoke - INDIA was my most successful Kickstarter project, with support from 1,165 backers in over 40 countries.
Since 2013 I have devoted almost all of my working hours to The Lotus and the Artichoke and other projects in the culinary field. In addition to writing my own cookbooks, I offer international vegan cooking classes, cooking demonstrations & shows, write recipes and do photography for other cookbooks and magazines. I also love to help others with translations, photography, design, and advice on their own projects – almost always dealing with art, travel, and food.
Lagos, Nigeria (World Veg Fest 2014)
PRAISE for The Lotus and the Artichoke
"The Lotus and the Artichoke spiegelt Justins Erlebnisse und seine Liebe zum Reisen und Kochen so nahbar und umfassend wider, dass man so manches Mal meint, selbst dabei gewesen zu sein!" – Nicole Just, Bestsellerautorin von La Veganista
“The Lotus and the Artichoke shares Justin’s love for cooking and world travel with such intensity and passion that you really feel like you were there!” – Nicole Just, bestselling author of La Veganista
"Unser allerliebster verrückter Weltreisender ist wieder da!" – Nadine Horn & Jörg Mayer, Bestseller-Autoren von eat this! Vegan kann jeder
"Ein fantastisches Buch, das nicht nur den Hunger, sondern mindestens ebenso doll das Fernweh weckt!" – Sarah Kaufmann, Autorin & Weltreisende von Vegan Guerilla and Outdoor Cooking
"A fantastic book that totally fires up your appetite and wanderlust!" – Sarah Kaufmann, Author & World Traveller from Vegan Guerilla and Outdoor Cooking
"Whether you're living life in paradise or trapped in the middle of the zombie apocalypse, the recipes in The Lotus and the Artichoke will make you feel as if you traveled to the unique places that inspired them." – Jon & Chris, The Vegan Zombie YouTube stars and authors of Cook & Survive!
"The Lotus and the Artichoke will open your mind to new tastes, new lands, and new adventures. I enjoy making these recipes with my family and teaching my young children how simple food choices have a profound impact on our health, the lives of animals, and our planet." – Kristen Palana, Aura's House & Veggie Propaganda
Delivery Day! The Lotus and the Artichoke - Malaysia. Nov 2016.
Kickstarter Rewards: The Lotus and the Artichoke - INDIA. Nov 2017.
Where does the funding go?
Food shopping & cooking costs
Kitchen, studio & photographic expenses
Artwork, illustration, design – 100+ hours of work!
Support translation expenses
Editing & proofreading help
Support printing costs and books bought from publisher
Reward production – Stickers, t-shirts, totebags, etc.
Postage expenses – for shipping your rewards
Kickstarter fees
How can you help?
SUPPORT this Kickstarter with a pledge
Pick a cool reward – Sponsor generously, enjoy the ride!
SHARE this Kickstarter – Tell your friends & followers on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, your blog, etc.
LIKE The Lotus and the Artichoke on FACEBOOK
Follow me on INSTAGRAM: @lotusartichoke
Follow me on TWITTER: @lotusartichoke
Visit lotusartichoke.com - Check out the recipes & stories!
Help with recipe testing – send a message or leave a comment!
Review my cookbooks on Goodreads & Amazon.com / Amazon.de / Amazon.co.uk
Contact me for info about interviews, articles, special features, exclusive recipes, and all kinds of publicity & promotion fun.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Kickstarter and crowdfunding can be crazy, messy, and dangerous. From tripled postage costs and doubled production expenses to unforeseen delays, partnership breakdowns, and other surprises – lots can happen! I should know. In the last 6 years, I've supported over a hundred campaigns by others, run 5 successful Kickstarter campaigns of my own, plus created and managed 3 more in the vegan/culinary scene, and consulted on over a dozen others behind the scenes.

Yes, I've got lots of experience with lots of stuff, but I also know when it's time to bring in others for help. I'm grateful for the incredible network of supporters and helpers I've got to make all of this happen, and make it awesome.

Crowdfunding is all about communication. The most important thing is to be honest and stay in touch. I'm here to involve you the process, keep it fun and entertaining, and make sure you get MORE than you expect.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
First of all- THANK YOU to all of you who have already joined the newest The Lotus and the Artichoke Kickstarter adventure for my updated, revised & re-envisioned WORLD 2.0 cookbook. There are so many returning backers from my previous 6 projects on Kickstarter... It's incredible to see your names and get your messages and support.
Without you, none of this could happen. It'd just be me in a kitchen getting messy, or me at my desk getting artsy & nostalgic with travel and culinary memories. This cookbook – yes, all of my cookbooks – would just be a dream. Kickstarter has enabled me to reach thousands of people, tremendous backer support has allowed me to help fund the production and printing of my books with an independent publisher. Your support and enthusiasm has kept me busy with my passions, and it's opened up new ideas, insights, and experiences for so many others in the process. There are people in over 50 countries all over the world reading these very words – How wild is that?!

updates.update_userinfo: The Lotus and the Artichoke - Vegan Recipes from World Adventures 2.0 on Kickstarter *NOW*
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
I hope you've been well, staying healthy, and finding fun & meaning in these strange times we're living in.
Maybe, like me, you've been spending an incredible amount of time in the kitchen this year... and going on your culinary adventures much, much closer to (or just at) home. I hope you've been enjoying your rewards and the cookbooks from the ETHIOPIA project -- back in 2018, which now kinda feels like 2 *thousand* years ago. Maybe that's because I shipped like 2 thousand packages in 2019 and played the same dozen songs on my ukulele in 2020... when not home-schooling or avoiding the news?

updates.update_userinfo: Last reward packages finally on the way!
updates.update_content: After weeks of waiting for the reprinted and restocked cookbooks, a couple of weeks battling with the postal website, and a few rolls of packaging tape, the last reward packages are finally going out!

The E-BOOKS are here!
Most of the last 3 days I've spent getting the new The Lotus and the Artichoke ETHIOPIA & ÄTHIOPIEN e-books thoroughly tested and online, the website updated and ready for you, and all of the download codes and links sent out to all backers with rewards including e-books. That's like over a thousand messages!

updates.update_userinfo: All E-Books online & download codes/links sent!
updates.update_content: Reminder! This weekend's events in Berlin:

updates.update_userinfo: Cookbook Release Party (Berlin) & Dinner Party Private Concert
updates.update_content:
Delivery Day!
Actually the delivery of my shipment of the new cookbooks was planned for Tuesday... but things kinda never go according to plan around here! Monday morning I got a phone call that the delivery truck was on my street – a day early – so I raced home on my bike (in the pouring rain) to meet the newest additions to The Lotus and the Artichoke cookbook family. I signed all the necessary paperwork and the truck unloaded two pallets piled high with ETHIOPIA cookbooks, and drove off. .

The last few weeks have been super crazy working some very late shifts to juggle and attempting to manage all my various crucial responsibilities (family, food, art, other projects, annoying grown-up things like taxes & bills, directing cyclists off the sidewalk, etc.) alongside putting together this wonderfully intricate puzzle to get this new cookbook written, photographed, designed, printed, and shipped.
A few backers recently nudged me to get on to the promised update and let y'all know what's up! Live from Berlin, it's me, taking a short break from this:
